text: Setelah melihat web dengan foto-fotonya yang menarik, saya memutuskan menginap di villa ini untuk kunjungan ke bali kali ini. Saya mendapatkan pelayanan yang sangat baik dari para staff mulai dari pertama kali saya kontak email dengan mereka hingga saya meninggalkan tempat ini. Sayang sekali pelayanan baik ini kurang ditunjang oleh fasilitas villa yang kurang memadai. Villa yang saya tempati tidak ada microwave,alat dapur sudah tidak lengkap,susah sekali menemukan tempat sampah, hingga jacuzzi yang tidak berfungsi. Hal yang mengganggu juga adalah letak AC di tiap kamar yang menyorot langsung ke tempat tidur hingga terasa kurang nyaman. Lokasi juga sedikit jauh dari keramaian Seminyak.

text:
Our family of 5 recently stayed 5 nights in Villa 9. Our first impressions were not good after travelling from the outer islands and being hot and bothered we arrived at 3pm (check in time) to be told the room was not ready and maybe go for a walk or shopping for an hour and come back later.
Upon returning we arrived at the villa which seemed impressive at the start but with closer inspection saw stains on the bed, the couches, the Mat on the floor and most walls but then the worst was the overpowering cigarette smell in my children’s room in a non smoking villa.
We alerted reception who came and sprayed perfume or air freshener all through the room which still did not work and the final solution was candle burners put in the room.
Our next realisation was the Villa is open plan and only the bedrooms have air conditioning so it’s hot and sticky in the living areas/ bathrooms and kitchen area which probably won’t bother some people but it was an issue for us sometimes.
The breakfast was served in the Italian restaurant at the front which was ok but compared to others pretty basic so we ventured out most mornings.
There is a shuttle 3 times a day around Seminyak which is drop off only and no return service.
Overall the Villas have beautiful pools and gardens but obviously some are getting tired and shabby.
I realise they are individually owned but if there are stains on the bed then clean it or stains on the Mat then just buy a new one.
Close the villa for a few days and give it a coat of paint it’s not that hard or expensive.
When you hear these comments in a lot of reviews then it needs addressing.
I don’t want to paint a terrible picture of the Layar and by all means it did not ruin our holiday but it’s a competitive market out there and when you are paying over $700 AUD per night it’s starting to get up there.
We did enjoy lounging beside the pool in the villa and the position is great to walk to Seminyak shops etc but as mentioned before it’s only small things that need addressing but it’s the small things which make a difference.
title: Could be better

owner_response.text:
Dear jamo5468,

Thank you for your review and feedback. We are currently undertaking a rigorous maintenance and upkeep program throughout the villas which will take care of all the "small things" as you say.
Kind regards,
Andrew J Leith

text:
We has just come back from Bali after spending 10 nights at The Layar. We stayed in Villa 18, towards the back of the complex which made for a quiet stay. The pool was a great temperature all day, and in the evening as it got sun for most of the morning / afternoon. The Villa itself is lovely, but starting to show its age with the following problems:

1. The Electricity in the Villa went off at 6.30am one morning. We thought it happened in the whole development but after waiting for a couple of hours, we found out it was just our Villa. The phones are run by the electricity, so we had to walk to reception to tell them the issue, and they did have someone to come and remedy the issue. 

2. No hot water in showers. This happened many times on our stay despite having the maintenance department have a look.

3. Phones had a constant crackle sound, and could not speak to reception. 

4 The Bed Linen and towels are worn and old with stains on the linen. I totally undertand that they were clean, but maybe throw out linen that has obvious stains and discoloured pillow cases? 

5 Strong Smell of gas when using shower in Bedroom 1. 

6 - The mattress on bedroom 1 needs to be replaced. It has broken springs and is uncomfortable. I appreciate they put a mattress topper on it when i complained, but another issue that really should be looked at..

6 Spa - useless, hard to get in and out of, stale water. 

The Villas would not be ideal for a family with young children, as there are so many hard edges, slippery tiles next to the pool when wet, uneven decking, shark edges on the beds, you really need to be careful when walking to the backroom at nights with the beds! 

The staff are all lovely, and when there was issues they tried their best to resolve quickly, but we felt the villa needs an extensive modernisation programme to rectify the issues and appearance. 

The pool is sensational, we spent a lot of time in there. 

I would recommend the Layar to anyone due to its location, its general style, excellent breakfasts (in the restaurant), but management do need to take into consideration that any property will need more maintenance work as they get older with a lot of use, and would recommend they do this sooner rather than later in Villa 18.
title: Superb Location Staff and Pool, Tired Villa.

owner_response.text:
Dear theirishstevie,

Many thanks for the review -appreciate the feedback.  I am sorry that you found a number of issues in your villa, despite the development only being seven years old, this is the tropics so everything needs extra attention. We do have rather extensive preventative and refurbishment maintenance programs, however, we have noted the need for further works. I am particularly disappointed about the linen as we do buy new linen twice a year - I will ensure all linen is inspected and any linen with marks are removed.
I am pleased that you would recommend The Layar and that you did enjoy your time here.
Kind regards
Andrew J Leith
owner_response.title: Tanggapan Pemilik

text: We stayed in a 3 bedroom villa with 2 other couples. Our accommodation was perfect for the week. The bedrooms were large and luxurious with outdoor bathrooms, each room had a spa bath with very comfy king size beds. The outside area was private, exotic with beautiful gardens. Another outside spa available for use. There was also a sunken outdoor lounge area. A full kitchen was included, dining area and undercover lounge area. Upstairs lounge entertainment area. Plenty of space for 6 guests to come together or separate. Bayu our butler was all smiles and extremely accommodating. All staff were lovely and very helpful. The golf buggy got us everywhere we needed to be locally. Breakfast was plentiful and a good selection available. The downside was that the villa is looking tired. The outdoor lounge furniture was heavily stained and extremely uncomfortable. The doors were falling of the kitchen cupboards, If a kitchen has a sink then a dish cloth should be supplied. No towel racks in the bathroom. Towels had to be placed on the floor while showering. No bottle opener to crack a cold beer. 6 guests and only 2 sun lounges. It was the small things that let this villa down. If you can let these pass then this is the place to stay.
title: Lovely place to stay

We have recently re-started a maintenance program to address these issues with several villas a month as we do not wish to have anything let our guests down in the villa.

text:
Retuned three weeks ago from a 12 night stay, making it our third return visit to The Layar.

I would love to give an excellent rating as I have done so n the past, but there was what I consider a serious short fall this time - NOISE. 

Yes, the Villas are open plan, but that doesn't bother me at all. If it did, we wouldn't keep coming back.

It's what can only be described as wild party noise. Yelling, screaming and unaceptable loud music blarring out way into the early hours of the morning. 

Management are no where near proactive enogh in this regard. Guests need to be sent a very clear message that loud, disturbing behaviour will not be tolerated. One warning only, followed by instruction to vacate the premises. Other guests should not be subject to such disturbance.

The Layar has an excellent reputation and this reputation needs to be upheld.

It's a beautiful location and all the staff are absolutely amazing,providing excellent service. The Villa itself, pool and gardens are maintained to a very high standard.

The buggy service is great, but we were disappointed with the timetable restrictions. In the past the service was offered on a much more regular basis

Dinned at the restaurant Settimo Cielo this visit and can definitely recommend it.

The big question - would we return? Yes, we will be back. Hopefully for a quieter stay.
Noise aside - I cannot fault
title: Home away from home

owner_response.text:
Dear Carol D,
Thank you very much for your feedback and I do apologise that the time during your return stay was a very noisy time.  We are being more proactive in putting the noise regulations into the welcome letter and registration cards.  Larger groups, though more difficult to monitor we are informing at check in about the noise issues. We also have a procedure to handle guest complaints.  Thank you for your compliments on the location and service.   Thank you also on your feedback regarding the buggy service, unfortunately due to long absences of the buggy causing other restrictions on services to our guests we did opt to have a timetable restriction.  Thank you for your recommendation on Settimo Cielo and we hope to welcome you back soon for a much quieter stay!
owner_response.title: Tanggapan Pemilik

text: The villas are well designed with really beautiful gardens. Each room in every villa opens to a private garden. The public areas are well landscaped and functional. The significant drawback is that sleeping at night with windows and doors open isn't possible because of mosquitoes so sleeping in air conditioning is the only option. The real problem is that the ac compressor is in the bedroom is extremely loud and prevents a good night's sleep. Not pleasant and a major design flaw.
title: Good not great

owner_response.text:
Dear Steve T,

Thank you for reviewing The Layar - Designer Villas and Spa.

We appreciate your comments that our villas are well designed with really beautiful gardens and well landscaped public areas. 

We take your feedback seriously. Especially for the comfort and convenience during your stay with us. We have done investigation for the air conditioner compressor and found that the noise might be happen when the air conditioner is set to maximum workload. This is not the case when the air conditioner has reached the desired temperature of the room. We always keep the room at comfort temperature which is 23 degrees Celsius to 25 degrees Celsius to avoid extra work on the compressor and save environment. 


Best Regards,
Anton Budiono
owner_response.title: Tanggapan Pemilik

text:
We stayed in a 3 bedroom (Villa 13) in early August.  We've stayed in many Bali villas but the pool in Villa 13 was the best by far, it was gorgeous...huge, deep in parts, spotlessly clean and yet the water was warm, the steps into the pool were also a great place to laze and read a book. The villa was well designed with high end decor. The spacious communal areas allowed us to socialise as a group or retreat into our own worlds. The bedrooms & bathrooms were roomy and luxurious. The aircon could have been better in the bedrooms but luckily the weather wasn't too hot. We had breakfast in both the villa and the restaurant as well as a room service dinner - on all occasions the food was of a high standard. The location is pretty good (it looks more remote on a map) and is about a 10min walk to Seminyak square or you could make use of the complimentary golf buggy service.
There service was a little inconsistent which is why rated it 4 stars instead of 5.
title: Top class villa and location

text: Quiet and well equipped, tranquil setting away from the busy roads. Staff were very friendly and accommodating. Not cheap, but overall very enjoyable. Room service food was also good. Buggy to the local areas was very useful.

text:
With ensuites to all the rooms and large communal areas, you were never far from a friend but still had your own private oasis to retreat to – when the sun and lounging around got too much!
 
As are all the most recent additions to Seminyak’s booming villa market, the Layar’s a tasteful blend between Balinese and contemporary design. The pool was fantastic and the adjacent lounge was a regular hang-out for all of us.  The restaurant attached to the villas has a banging dinner and dessert menu too – which stands up strongly to some of the areas other dining institutions.  It’s a must if you’re staying here.
 
We all unanimously felt that its only flaw was that the villa could have benefited from having one of the, or part of the, communal areas enclosed from the mosquitos and elements.  A glass divider? Something to have kept us better cooled and protected, especially at night.  It also made the prospect of actually cooking something in the heat unappealing.  It really wasn’t that much of an inconvenience, just good to call it out if air-conditioned communal areas are a must for you.
 
Would definitely consider staying there again with a small group.
title: Paradise

text: My daughter was staying in one of the private villas which was absolutely beautiful. They are well maintained, the pool, surrounded by frangipani trees was just outside the bedroom sliding doors. The marble bath tub was outside so you could lay back and see the stars at night. It had a full kitchen with fridge and wine fridge. Comfy lounge area overlooking the pool sets a very relaxing scene. My husband and I were booked in elsewhere but decided to have dinner at the resort restaurant. My husband, a chef was very impressed with the food and we ended up having all of our breakfasts and dinners there over the three days. The food is very reasonably priced and the quality is four star. The manager of the resort, Andrew personally welcomes all resort guests and overall we could not fault the entire resort.
title: Perfect

text:
Stunning villas set down a lane makes for a peaceful and relaxed stay. 

The great:

Generous pool size
We were upgraded from 1 bedroom to 2 bedroom 
Very unobtrusive but thorough housekeeping
Sound system to hook your music to
Very spacious including mezzanine lounge
Great wifi
Great restaurant associated with villas 

The not so great:

Despite request to fix, shower in one bathroom next to useless with poor flow and erratic hot water

The free shuttle service is haphazard. Unavailable a lot of the time, wouldn't venture far, wouldn't turn up although booked.

The pool loungers had no cushions and were very uncomfortable to "lounge" on for too long

It's these (admittedly little niggles) that mean it's not a 5 star rating unfortunately.

text:
This is my second stay at The Layar villa 5 (which is the 4 bedroom villa) and it was simply excellent. The pool was a very size and the service was top notch. 
The Layar provides complimentary buggy service from the villa to a good number of places in Seminyak (including Potato Head and Seminyak Square) which was really convenient. 

My friend's daughter left her soft toy at the villa and the villa informed me after we were back in Singapore.

Fortunately, another friend who was still in Bali made a detour (on her way to Potato Head) to The Layar to collect the soft toy on my behalf. Upon collecting the toy from The Layar, the villa staff sent my friend to Potato Head. They didn't have to do it, but the service even we have checked out was simply outstanding.

Bravo, to all staff of The Layar!

text:
The accomodation itself was luxe, but there were a few minor things including the service that wasn't quite what you would expect for the price tag. It was a nice stay but I wouldn't give this the 5 star rating I was expecting.

We stayed in the one bedroom villa (2b) and it is gorgeous. 

Pros:
- The villa is beautiful. The indoor/outdoor living and dining which overlook the pool are a delight to relax in. And when it gets a bit too warm, the pool is right there to cool off in.
- The bedroom is WELL air conditioned and the king bed is incredibly comfortable!
- The giant bath tub doesn't take too long to fill up, and is a perfect spot to relax for 1 or 2 people! 
- Massages are very well priced ($35 for 90 min reflexology massage) and easy to organise at the room
- Room service (lunch/dinner) was quite nice if you can't be bothered to leave, although good to note that prices were comparable with Sydney Australia room service prices and similar quality expectations to typical room service. People talk about wine being expensive in Bali, however the wine list for room service was pretty extensive and similar price to what you'd pay in Australia. Good to note that you can't order cocktails to the villa, so if you like the idea of pool side cocktails - bring your own.

Cons:
- The breakfast (included) is very weak. Dishes are small and tasteless, and the fruit tastes like it's come from a can, even though it hasn't. I'd suggest going out elsewhere for breakfast eg Ku De Ta
- The wifi didn't work for days at a time. I had read  in reviews the wifi was a bit spotty and at the time thought "so what? We're on a relaxing holiday we don't need wifi". But actually it did prove an annoyance.
- The pool was highly chlorinated, and sent my hair a shade of green (although probably better to be chlorinated rather than the alternative!)
- The water pressure in the shower wasn't great
- While the outdoor bathroom looks nice, in practise the proximity of the kitchen/living room to the bathroom isn't fantastic. There is no door to close off the bathroom from the kitchen area and if you're unluckily enough to get Bali Belly, an air conditioned bathroom would be nicer if you're spending lots of time in there!
- the staff were nice, but didn't go above and beyond as you might expect at a 5 star place. For example:

* Asking reception to book a taxi, felt like a bit of a chore for them 
* No help with luggage, and the villa isn't located next door to reception
* The hotel contacted us a few days before our arrival and asked us if we'd like early check in, we thought "why not".  We were staying an hour away in Ubud and were in no rush to leave but on the day of checkin, at midday, they still couldn't confirm if we'd be able to check in at 1 or not, so we decided not to race to the hotel and just check in at the usual time of 3pm.
* In February when we booked we had asked if a late check out was possible, because our flight wasn't until 10.30pm. The person we spoke to said absolutely, and that we could pay a discount of the room rate (which would still be $250-300) to secure it or we could wait until closer too and if there was availability we could get it complementary. In April just before our trip we contacted the hotel by email again and were told that the request for complementary late check out had been added to our file, but they couldn't confirm availability until closer too (fair enough). The night before we checked out, the hotel said they couldn't confirm our complimentary late check out until the next morning. The morning we were checking out, at 8am, we followed up with reception and were told management didn't start for a few hours so they couldnt confirm anything yet. At this stage we wanted to know so we could head out for the morning, or pack up and plan to book at a cheaper hotel for just the day so we could shower before our flight etc. Eventually they told us the room wasn't available for late check out, as it had been booked by someone else, unless of course we wanted to pay 🤔
* Nb, the housekeeping team who came to the actual villa were a delight, it was just reception and management who were less so.
title: Accomodation beautiful, service so/so

owner_response.text:
Dear Aegreen,

Thank you for having time to review The Layar - Designer Villas and Spa.
We appreciate your feedback that our villa are beautiful.  The bedroom is well air conditioned with a comfortable king bed, also for the large bathtub, and other services that you had during your stay with us (massages, room service and wine selection).

We are disappointed and a little surprised that you felt our included breakfasts were weak, as we do get many positive comments on both the quality and quantity of our breakfasts.  Along with either freshly prepared cut fruits or fruit salad served with with kaffir syrup, mint and toasted coconut, breakfasts include a pastry basket, fresh juice, French press or Italian caffettiera Javanese coffee and/or a tea selection, along with a selection of one of eleven ‘main’ breakfast dishes.

Taking note from some previous guest comments we have upgraded our internet  infrastructure to ensure that all villas and public area are covered by as strong as possible WiFi signal.  Unfortunately during your stay the internet connection from our internet provider went down and cut internet access to all those that use this provider not just The Layar.  Please do accept our apologies for this.

Your comment regarding the level of chlorination in our pools is a first and we will look into our procedures for this. 

We thank you for your constructive feedback for the air-conditioning in the bathroom.  However, our bathroom is open space and designed to be cooled down by the natural air movement through our lush garden. There is a drop down screen that can be used for privacy between the bathroom and kitchen area.

We have been investigating  the issue regarding your requested early check in and late check out. In times of high occupancy we can have last minute reservations and cannot inconvenience arriving guests by making them wait for the previous guests to check out past the normal check in time. That is the reason we could not confirm your complimentary late check out until the day of your departure.  We do understand this can be frustrating when trying to make departure plans, however, we tried to explain this but it seems that we failed to do so.  Guests do on occasion contact us requesting an early check-in and if villas are available we generally offer this complimentary, however, without payment for the previous night we cannot guarantee a check-in time prior to checkout time.  We are a small boutique property with a limited number of villas so do not have the villa numbers to simply ensure that each reservation has no guest staying in the villa before or after each reservation to allow for an automatic early check in or late check out. 
Our reception was surprised when you came to lobby with your luggage as our guests normally call our butlers or reception to arrange for luggage and buggy assistance upon check out.  We are sorry that his may have not been made clear to you and shall endeavor to inform all guests that any assistance is only a phone call away.

We thank you for having stay with us and are sorry that you felt our service was not what you would expect for the price tag.  We are pleased that you did enjoy the majority of your stay and do hope to serve you better in the future.

Kind regards,
Anton Budiono

text:
Wow is the first word that comes to mind when you walk into these villas. Beautifully set out with everything you could hope for. I stayed here with a group of friends for a week during Nyepi. 

The rooms are private and not on top of each other which is great when you are staying with friends. We stayed in the four bedroom villa. 

Staff are friendly and are happy to accommodate any requests. There is a team of butlers that will shop for you, make reservations and are happy to organize anything you need. The villas buggy will drop you anywhere in the local area on request. 

We all enjoyed spa treatments on Nyepi day which were great. ( I would recommend changing their relaxing music as it had babies crying, sirens, roosters etc which is the last thing I want to hear. I'm sure if I'd been bothered to say something they would have changed it). 
The food was also great. 

There were a couple of minor issues which once we spoke to the villa staff were rectified immediately showing us that they are flexible and accommodating to your personal needs. 

Overall the six of us were very impressed with the Layar and would stay again in a second.

Our group of 6 stayed at the Layar for 3days 2nites in March.  We were very excited with this stunning and excellent spacious layout of this villa.

But, we have bad time with 2 of the bedrooms with mozzies biting and flying from one ear to the other ear the whole night. The next morning, it was disheartened to see our family members especially my son body was full of bites front and the back, also on both legs.
We have requested for some electric mosquito repellents for all 3 rooms several times but came in quite late afternoon on the 2nd night. :(

We felt that having breakfast at the restaurant was so much better than having it in the villas.
Great restaurant at Settimo Cielo, good menus and we really enjoyed the food.
Appreciated your complimentary desserts too.
We have to thank you the staffs from Settimo Cielo with a surprised birthday cake.
We appreciated their thoughts and very attentive to our needs.

Overall, we have great time in Bali !

Veronica L
title: The 3 bedrooms villa experience at The Layar - Designer Villas and Spa

owner_response.text:
Dear Vlly L,

Thank you for sharing your experience during stay at The :Layar - Designer Villas and Spa.

We are glad to hear that you were excited with our stunning and excellent spacious layout villa. Also for your great dining experience and birthday cake surprise in our restaurant Settimo Cielo.

We are aware of mosquitos flying around our villa property especially in the open living area and open bathroom. Unfortunately mosquitoes are inevitable in a tropical climate like Bali. We do many efforts to anticipate this by doing mosquito fogging and pest control twice a week, which is done as discretely and fast as possible. The same do our neighbor resorts so that the area surrounding us is actually kept as mosquito-free as possible. However the effectiveness of this is at times limited by winds that can carry new mosquitoes from more distant lands. For this reason we do fogging also on guest request and provide extra repellents and coils if necessary.  

We thank you for having stay with us and look forward to welcoming you back sometime in the future.

Best Regards,
Anton Budiono

owner_response.text:
Dear Noem_R187514 ,

Thank you for having time to review The Layar - Designer Villas and Spa.

We are happy to hear that you found our villas to be very nice with great pool, bathrooms and common areas.

We are sorry that you felt the cleaning was poor and that the beds were uncomfortable.  The vast majority of our guests enjoy a great night’s sleep in our beds, however, on the rare occasion one of our guests finds the beds a little firm, we do provide extra padded comforter for them.  It is unfortunate that we did not know we could have improved your stay with this.

In regard to the cleaning of our villas we do apologize that you encountered some spots on our linen.  This is certainly unacceptable as, not only is the linen less than three months old, but our procedures of multiple checks on the quality and cleanliness of our linens has let us down.  I do trust that this was rectified for you during your stay.  We will certainly review our procedures to ensure this doesn’t happen again.

We do hope that you enjoyed your stay with us despite the issues you raised in your review and thank you for bringing these to our attention.

text:
We loved everything about our stay at Layar Villas! The friendly staff, the beautifully designed villas and the location to the surrounding restaurants and cafes.
We were very impressed with the free door-to-door golf buggy service. They pick you up from your villa and drop you to your desired destination in Seminyak, i.e. Ku De Ta or Sisterfields. This saves so much hassle trying to organise a taxi pick-up and very safe with young children.
You have a choice daily whether to eat breakfast in the resort's restaurant or have it delivered to your villa. You also have in-room dining service for lunch and dinner, so basically you have all the perks of hotel living, but in the privacy of your own villa.
We would definitely stay here again, the villas are modern and photogenic and the location is perfect!

title: Underwhelmed

owner_response.text:
Dear marnihouston,

Thank you for reviewing The Layar - Designer Villas and Spa.

We are certainly pleased that you found our villas to be beautifully designed and very private, and that you found the staff nice.

We do apologize, however, for the services that did not meet your requirements.  Our buggy drop off service is available at to all of our guests anytime  from 9am until 6pm within our local area.  Additionally, we do provide a welcome drink which is a passionfruit spritzer infused with rosemary, as well as a refreshing cool towel, upon check-in.

 

It is somewhat distressing that you felt the staff did the bare minimum as we pride ourselves on our service and the staff willingness to cater to our guests needs.  From our pre-arrival guest service staff to the hosts and butlers that escort guest to our villas, to the housekeepers, gardeners, food & beverage personnel, and to the turn down staff that set up your villa for a restful night sleep; we all pride ourselves on providing the best service we can.  Something we think is evident to our guests and as recorded in the vast majority of our TripAdvisor comments.

 
We do thank you for your feedback.

Kind regards,

text:
Upon arrival we were greeted by staff, and it was a friendly and quick process. I usually hate waiting to get checked in but it was a smooth process and we were walking to our villa within 10 mins of arriving with a cocktail in hand!

I stayed with my brother and best friend in a two bedroom villa for 10 nights and it was beautiful (we were suppose to stay 8 nights but extended). We had a pool and jacuzzi to ourselves, with an outdoor area including tanning beds and a dining room. It couldn't get much better! Not only was the villa in great condition but the design was open and modern. The place looks just like the photos!! What was also cool was that we had our own private stereo, which meant we could plug in our phones/ipods and play music as loud as we wanted and it still didn't bother our neighbors. Thats how big the villas were! My brothers favorite part of the villa was easily the outside shower, it was kept clean and bug free and he used only the outside shower the entire holiday.

Service was on point. Everyone was always smiling and courteous and we appreciated it. It really sets for a nice environment when people are friendly and helpful. 

We ordered a lot of room service, almost everyday, and each meal was fresh, delicious and healthy (fish, meat, salad, eggs benedict). The fresh juices were great too. It was just too easy and too good to leave. When we were not ordering food, we went down for the hotel breakfast which was plentiful with everything from fluffy pancakes to savory meats to pain au chocolate. 

Lastly, the location was great for us. We were just a 10 min walk from Seminyak square where we grabbed some food and bought a few souvenirs. We took the hotel buggy a couple of times, which takes you wherever you want to go. There are tons of bars and restaurants around the area if you want a rowdy night. 

Easily my favorite place in the world!
title: Beautiful 10 days spent at Layar

text:
My husband and I and my best friend and her husband stayed in a 2 bedroom villa at The Layar in June for 2 weeks to celebrate mine and my best friend's 40th birthdays. It was a special occasion and our friends were flying all the way from England so we wanted to stay somewhere 5 star.
Whilst the villa was lovely, for the price you pay to stay there we certainly expected there to be king size beds in the enormous bedrooms but alas they were both queen size and when one of our parties is 6 foot 3 inches tall, a queen bed is not ideal. We all had king beds at home and expected a 5 star villa to have the same. 
They also need to upgrade there bath and pool towels which were very worn, thin and small. Again, not exactly luxury. The pool towels also had an unpleasant smell each day so we weren't sure if they were freshly laundered or not! 
With the good reviews we had read about the restaurant at The Layar we expected the breakfasts to be of a decent standard, however they were very disappointing and after a few days of trying various things on the menu, we ended up just going out to local cafes for breakfast instead.
The staff were all very lovely while we were there however we had a very bad experience with their service after leaving the villa. Once we got to the airport our friends realised that they had left their duty free perfumes and aftershaves in the villa wardrobe. They immediat contacted The Layar who advised they had found it and would hold it for them. On arrival back home in England, our friends phoned and emailed The Layar several times to try to organise an express post or international courier to collect the goods and they would obviously pay for them to send the goods to England. This proved too difficult to organise via The Layar so they asked the villa to hang onto the goods as we had some other friends going to Bali in the coming months and they would collect it and send it on.
My friend contacted The Layar to confirm the date our other friends would be there to collect it and everything was arranged for the pick up. When our other friends went to collect the goods they were told they could not be found and when they complained to the manager it was still to no avail. 
We are now back in Bali again and we went back to The Layar today to see if we could collect the goods but were told that they only hold goods for 3 months and if they are not collected they they get rid of them. Needless to say we were livid that this had occurred and that $300 worth of goods was not returned to us. It's just not acceptable considering all the contact our friends had made with The Layar to advise the goods would be collected. At no point did the The Layar advise that they had a 3 month disposal policy for goods left behind. 
We will never stay at The Layar again.
title: Overrated.

owner_response.text:
Dear Kylee H,
 
Thank you for taking your time to review your stay with us in June. 

I am sorry you felt that our beds were small and can certainly understand how someone 6’3” would feel this way.  Whilst “king” size beds vary around the world our beds - at 180cm by 200cm or 71in by 79in - would certainly be considered king size in most parts of the world.  I am happy to advise that we have replaced and upgraded all of our linen and toweling including the quantity and quality of weight and thread count of the toweling and linen; and can assure you that, as always, these are laundered daily or as requested. 

It is disappointing that you found our breakfast to be very disappointing, as you mentioned they and our restaurant garner considerable rave reviews.  Without specifics it is difficult to try to remedy any shortfall in service or quality that you experienced but will certainly review our product and procedure’s ensure we are providing the very best we can in terms of food quality and service. 

Thank you for your kind comments regarding the loveliness of both the Villa and our staff.

 In regard to the items you left in your villa upon departure, please do accept our apologies that they were disposed of after holding them for over three months for you.  Unfortunately, we cannot keep lost property items for extended periods of time.  The last email contact we had with you was on the 17th June when we informed you of the customs requirements, and significant costs of returning the goods to you.  A phone call from you stating that someone would come and pick them up at some time was the last contact we had until your friend came to pick up the goods four months later.  Whilst I understand the loss any personal items, including toiletries, can be upsetting I do believe in this case we tried our utmost to return the items to you, and waited for an appropriate amount of time for someone to come and pick them up.

It is certainly disappointing, to all of us here at The Layar, that this incident seems to have soured your initial positive experience you had whilst staying with us, and we would certainly like to host you again in the future.  Please do let us know if this should be the case.

Kind Regards,
Anton Budiono

text: I was looking for a big enough villa for my family which included  three sons and two daughters (from our combined marriage) to celebrate my birthday  located in Seminyak. It was not easy to find a beautiful villa of that size and so we were happy to locate The Layar and its 4 bedrooms (two masters, two double rooms all with own bathrooms), family social room, private message area, and big garden for barbecues and just enjoying the great pool.  The pictures were impressive but I was careful not to put my hope to high as I have had experiences where the pictures are not like the experience.  This is not the case at all.  The Layar villa which we stayed in was indeed beautiful, wonderful. Frankly, we did not experience any issues that other guests writing seem to complain about like mosquitos or bad service.  It could be that we are also "low maintenance" people and the villa had all the amenities for us to take care of ourselves when we needed (including all the dishes and other needs should we need to cook ourselves)  While we are Indonesians, butlers were frankly not important for us so long as we had our rooms cleaned. Also perhaps as we are Indonesians, we did not have a communication problem. But then as some people know when you travel in Indonesia, you cannot always expect the people to speak fluent English.  As part of the price of staying, we enjoyed a quality breakfast of about 6-7 choices set menu and though not like menus in a big hotel like Sofitel, these were very nice and well done (coffee, fruits, big main dish like egg benedict, pancakes, omelette and bacon, egg white  to healthier options).  The Italian restaurant was convenient, and served good snacks for the kids like pizza and other Italian delicacies. The Layar location was near enough that we could also enjoy local places like Ku De Ta, Potata Head and local shops. However we decided for our stay to rent a car for our use as although the place says "walking distance" it is not safe to walk at night. Bali taxis are not recommended. So in brief, I thoroughly loved our stay and it was a wonderful 50th birthday I will always remember.  I will come back again without thinking.  Yes it is not cheap, and I do not know -- perhaps to some it is not perfect --  but having been in Bali many times and enjoyed various resorts there (as well as other hotels around the word) I think for  the needs of a family my size, it was great.
title: Perfect Bali Villa Experience For Larger Family Stay

text:
Just came back from staying at The Layar for 10 nights.  My partner and I have been going to Bali for the last 14 years & have stayed at a lot of hotels, resorts and villas but for the last 3 years we have concentrated on just staying in villas. We always go to Bali for 3 weeks so we split our stay at 2 villas. One a bit low key & one really fancy.
We decided we would stay at The Layar on the second leg of our trip because the photos they post on their Instagram page look amazing. 

First of all you have to pay upfront for your stay about a month before you arrive which I found a bit strange and when I queried it, reservation said that it is their company policy and because "The Villa needed the full payment to used for the miscellaneous they have to prepare before your arrival" (their words). We accepted that and paid in full. So by them stating the above, we were expecting great things from this villa as anyone would when you are paying just under $500 per night. 

We stayed at the Sun Island Boutique Villa near Bingtang supermarket for our first 10 nights and it was wonderful as usual (we have stayed there twice before). The service is great, fantastic location and the most comfortable bed and pillows ever.  The linen and towels were changed daily without being asked & they were clean and crisp. The air con was working great too. So by the time we were checking out of the Sun Island, we were extremely excited to check into The Layar as you can imagine.

The check in process at The Layar was very easy and we were taken to our villa soon after. We were shown where everything was and what was "chargeable". The first thing we noticed was that the air con in the bedroom was not blowing cold air. So we fiddled around with the remote to see if we could get it going a bit better but to no avail. So we rang reception and they got the maintenance team to have a look at it. All they did was pulled off the front cover of the unit and said to wait 1 hour to see if it gets any better but in the meantime "we will give you a fan"! After 1 hour, it did not come good. On our way out to dinner with friends we went into reception and told them it is still not working and guess what their response was? "The unit is already set at it's maximum capacity and isn't the fan we gave you working!!??" I think this is when i lost my sense of humour! I had to remind them that I didn't pay this kind of money per night "upfront" so you can "prepare for our arrival" to get a fan in the bedroom! The air con was fixed when we got back from dinner thank god but the point is I shouldn't have had to kick up a stink for them to fix it.

As part of the package, it stated that the sheets will be changed daily. On our first night we noticed that the bed sheet was already stained before we even got into bed! So gross! So we had to request them to be changed. So I wonder what did they do to "prepare for our arrival"!  All the linen & towels did not look clean, they either had stains on them or just didn't smell clean. Not what white towels should look or feel like at a 5 star villa. The bed was uncomfortable, it felt old. I could even feel the springs at times.

There were sometime 4 to 5 security guards on duty but none of them understand or speak English so my partner and I joked what if there was an emergency? What would they all do? They don't even guide traffic in or out of their driveway! 

The breakfast at the restaurant was ok, a bit too over the top for a breakfast menu so after having breakfast there 2 mornings, we just went to Sea Circus, Sisterfields, Livingstone Bakery & Kim Soo for breakfast. 

We so wanted to give this villa a great review but was very disappointed with it. We won't be staying there again. There are so many other luxury villas around that area for the same price like Equilibia Seminyak which we stayed at last year. The experience was amazing there! I think the management at The Layar needs to know that the guests' experience is everything and if they want their guests to come back or even to recommend the villa, they will need to pay a lot more attention to the finer details.  My partner and I both work in the prestige car / customer service industry and we both know that the clients' experience and your data base is priceless!
title: Not worth the money!

text:
From the moment of our arrival, as we were greeted with a wonderful crew, we felt like we had entered another world! It is truly a sublime paradisiac villa residence. 
Travelling with my brother for the 4th time in Bali, this was definitely the most amazing place we stayed at. I was truly amazed when I saw our villa at the Layar.  The beach is close but it is difficult to leave this wonderful villa: amazing pool, amazing layout, totally private and silent, architecture is typically from Bali, so why would you leave this paradise?! Even the restaurant and the room service is one of the best food we had in Bali. The meals offered were excellent. The overall atmosphere was serene and peaceful. 
The service is exceptional with a high-quality staff. A call and they are right here at your door. 
The Layar is THE place to stay if you are looking for a paradise in Bali, close to everything, private, natural, silent, relaxing, there is no such place I know in Bali better than the Layar Villas. 
We want to thank the staff and owners for their wonderful welcoming and service all the stay long. 
The only problem is that you never want to leave this Villa!!! It is too good to stay there, it is true vacation!!!

Thank you The Layar!!

text: Was invited to a wedding in Bali and wasn't sure what to expect...! I was truly amazed when I saw our villa at the Layar....absolutely superb! Very private with our own pool, and a great place to be with my sisters. We were so well looked after...even transported  to the nearby shops. Restaurant on the premises where we had breakfast and meals was extremely good. Our breakfasts could also be delivered to the villa and were again of a very high quality. Would be very keen to return to the Layar for a sisterly reunion again....we were looked after so well and treated like princesses!
title: Absolutely superb!

text: The Layar features a collection of spacious,  beautiful designer villas ideal if you are looking to stay in Seminyak. We loved the villa design with modern features, comfortable rooms, a large pool with plenty of lounging space, and a fully equipped kitchen. They offer free local buggy service making it easy to explore Seminyak's shopping and restaurants, and the chic space is great for dinner parties or hanging out with friends. We had a very comfortable and accommodating stay.
title: Chic and Luxurious Villas at the center of Seminyak

text:
We spent nine nights at the Layar Villas in a two bedroom apartment.  Overall the villas were excellent.  The villa was very comfortable with enough space for everyone to spread out and they are aesthetically appealing.  The pool was a good size and we were provided with blow up pool lilos etc. We ate breakfast in the restaurant each morning by choice and the food was of high standard for Bali.  We ordered in room service a few times and the homemade pastas were exceptional and the pizzas and salads were also very good.  Our only issue would be the wireless connection was often weak and we had the technician in a few times to address the issue.  The villa was well located near to Seminyak eat street and the villas provided a buggy service to take us to a chosen destination within a certain range from the villas.
Overall I would recommend staying at the villas.
title: We would stay at Layar again

text: Took the 3-bedroom villa for me and a group of friends. We really love the sophisticated design of the villa. The bedrooms were spacious and very comfy. The bathrooms were designed with indoor/outdoor sections and huge bath tubs. The living room itself is very spacious and they have a fully equipped kitchen as well. As for the breakfast (in-villa or restaurant, your choice!), they have quite a few options ranging from Indonesian food, Australian-brunch food and a range of bread. In particular, I liked the mie goreng (fried noodle, Indonesian food). We loved the pool as it is quite huge for all of us and they have a nice resting shaded place in the middle. You can also request some floaties from the villa (better to book in advance!). The location of the villa is in Seminyak (where there are a looooot of nice food and cafes around the area, some within walking distance..if you can bear the sun in Bali) so it is very convenient.  They also have in-house massage but we did not have the time to try it before. Lastly, note that it is open air space in the public areas (living/dining room and kitchen) hence it might get a bit hot and tend to attract mosquitoes especially at night. Overall, we really enjoyed our stay here!
title: Beautiful villa, really love it!

text:
I just came back from a 4 night stay at the 3 bedroom villa #8. Overall, the villa is nice, and the service is great. 

Firstly, I would like to comment on the good things about the villa: 
1) The wifi was fine during my stay. 
2) There were mosquitoes, but much less than I expected; you can rest by the pool without any biting you! :) and there were no mosquitos in the rooms. 
3) Late checkout was given by the general manager Andrew to facilitate late flight back to Sydney. Thankyou so so much! 
4) In villa spa is great, getting aromatherapy massage by the pool with the natural wind was super relaxing. And there is a sound system you can use to play relaxing music while you get a treatment done too. 
5) Loved the pool area! 

However, I would also like to mention a few points for future improvement: 
1. The kitchen could be better equipped - there was no microwave and no frying pans. 
2. There was no phone in my room - but was placed when I mentioned it to reception. *It would also be nice if we can answer the calls from reception from all the rooms (we could only answer from the living room, which meant we need to run out from the bedrooms every time we got a call.., and it could be 4-5 calls in a day...) 
3. Perhaps security could walk around the villas during night time - there was a villa that would blast loud music at 4am and I had to call reception to come and get it under control; which they did.., but it would be nicer if someone controlled them before we got woken up, as we had trouble falling asleep again... 
4. Hotel bathroom amenities could be better.., shampoo and conditioner quality was not the best, and there were no toothbrush/toothpaste available (they brought me some when I asked though), no cotton buds or cotton pads etc. 
5. The rooms in the lower floor had a sewer smell coming from the bathroom when the water is turned on. 
6. Cleaning could be improved. There was a lot of dust in areas that isn't easy to see, like behind the mattress (you don't have to lift the mattress - can see if you look, but not if on purpose), sofa etc. 
7. The bed frame sticks out and my mother banged her leg continuously during the stay which really annoyed her... 

But overall, our family enjoyed the spacious and beautiful villa; and especially the service from the staff. I would like to thankyou all for your smiling faces and service.
title: Great stay

owner_response.text:
Dear Yunsun H ,

Thank you for reviewing The Layar - Designer Villas and Spa.

We are glad to hear that you enjoyed our villa facilities which including the Wi-Fi and swimming pool, as well as the in villa aroma therapy massage and  late check out given by our General Manager.

We thank you for your feedback to improve our services in the future. We take your feedback seriously and will use this to improve our service to all guests.  However, we would like to clarify few things.
1. Microwave is not a standard setup in our villa. However, we can provide if required, especially for guests are traveling with a baby. However, we are currently upgrading the cutlery, crockery, and cookware in our villas.
2. All of the phone in the bedrooms are able to pick up call from reception. We normally call the bedroom when no one picks up the phone in the living room.
3. Our security do regular checks through the property day and night, and attempt to control and issue as soon as possible.
4. We provide complimentary tooth brush, tooth paste and shaver on request.
5. Apologies for the smell from the bathroom, we will investigate and ensure this doesn’t happen again.
6. We have shared your feedback to housekeeping so they can improve the cleanliness especially under the bed / mattress
7. Some of our beds do have an oversized wooden frame as part of the design.

Thank you for having time to write this review. We look forward to welcoming you back at The Layar - Designer Villas and Spa.

Regards,
Anton Budiono

text:
The Layar villas is the most beautiful family accomodation in Seminyak. I stayed in the 4 bedroom villa and my partner and I enjoyed a detached bedroom in the garden while our young adult family were in the main house. There is a big pool and a spa in the gorgeous landscaped garden with heaps of sun lounge options and a massage room down the garden path. Each bedroom has a king size bed, TVs, outside bath, private garden courtyard and heaps of wardrobe space. The main house have a fully equipped kitchen, an open living room and a mezzanine theatre room. The staf came in to cook a complimentary breakfast each morning and clean.
They have a beautiful Italian restaurant, huge selection of room service meals, buggies to drop you off in the local area and airport shuttle. Each of us also got a complimentary head and shoulder massage and complimentary drink and refresher towel on arrival. The place is heaven!

owner_response.text:
Dear Zels1,

Thank you for taking time to review The Layar - Designer Villas and Spa, and we apologize for  the inconvenience arising from the issues you have experienced during your stay with us

Whilst our WiFi infrastructure ensures that all villas and public area are covered by a generally strong WiFi signal, one of the small sacrifices we make to living or holidaying in Bali is slow internet upload and download speeds.  We do also occasionally have issues with our WiFi routers, which we do check prior to all guest arrivals, however, these do sometimes need re-setting.  We are sorry that these issues interfered with the enjoyment of your stay.

Unfortunately, there was a malfunction with the fiber optic feed from our TV provider, and whilst this was corrected promptly we realize this is not the standard of service we pride ourselves on.  In an effort to help the environment and save water and electricity, we give our guests the option to only change the dirty towels that they leave on the floor, if the towels are hung up this means the guest want to use it again and we will not replace with the new one.  I am sorry this was poorly communicated to you, and we have double checked that the notice in our villas bathrooms are present to ensure that our guests are aware of this policy.

Unfortunately some insects are inevitable in a tropical climate like Bali. The open living areas of our villas also on occasion bring our guests in in contact with the local insect life, and whilst we make a concerted effort to minimize this such as mosquito fogging and a further pest control program twice a week, it is very difficult to eliminate altogether.
 
Thank you for having time to write this review on Tripadvisor, and again please accept our apologies for the issues you encountered that impacted the enjoyment of your holiday.

Regards,
Anton Budiono

text: We highly recommend The Layar and will stay here again on our next trip to Bali. We were upgraded to a two bedroom villa (18) at the back of the property clean, modern, very private and quite. Buggy service if you didn't want to walk.  Loved the staff, so friendly, helpful and with any request being attended to immediately.  The general Manager Federico Soccio was wonderful he went out of his way to make the day of our wedding anniversary celebration very special. Sending a big bunch of red roses and sourcing my husbands request for lobster (supplied at a very nominal price) to be included in that nights 'villa romantic dinner' menu. Also organizing a day trip to the North of the island to places he loved to visit. It was the Bali as we fondly remembered it after an absence of 30 years.  A lovely day. His restaurant Settimo Cilelo, Italian for Seventh Heaven, 'Rustic Refined Italian', located in front of the villas was a pleasant surprise, exceptional food, great cocktails and service. We opted for our daily breakfast in the restaurant as opposed to in-villa service. A good selection of juices and different than the normal breaky options.  We loved for nibbles the Arancino of beef wagu just the best we have ever had. Also outstanding was the homemade Pappardelle with rabbit and porcini mushrooms and the Porchetta.  Wonderful food from Aussie chef Nicolas Lazzaroni. Reasonable prices for such great food. Great location, short walk to the main shopping centre and restaurants.  They also offer you a one way buggy service to various location in Seminyak. Try the W Hotel for drinks (a bit pricy for Bali) great location.  Our villa had a great pool area with fully equipped kitchen, dining area and three lounge (one on a second level) areas all not air-conditioned.  Our only concern was that the villa lacked an air-conditioned area to relax in.  The only area was that of our bedroom (not the ensuite) with one lounge chair. They offered us a very late check out until we were ready to get to the airport for our 11.25pm flight. Over all we couldn't have asked for more for our 6 night stay. A special thank you to Federico and staff for making our stay such a special memory.
title: A lasting memory

owner_response.text:
Dear fudgieboy ,

Thank you for sharing your experience during stay at The Layar - Designer Villas and Spa here on TripAdvisor.

We would like to thank you for the positive comments on design, service, food, staff, and our restaurant Settimo Cielo.

We are sorry to hear you have been concerned by lack of air-conditioned living areas to relax in. Our villa design (as many in Bali) is characterized by open plan living areas that connects the interior to the garden and pool. Furthermore a unique characteristic of our design is the elevation of the villas and presence of back gardens, that allows breeze to flow-through, creating thus a natural air-conditioning, which is further helped by ceiling fans and standing fans. Some our larger villas (the four bedroom and dome superiors three bedrooms) provide however air-conditioned media rooms to relax.

text:
Just stayed for four nights in a two-bedroom villa.
The villa and property are very modern, clean and well designed. 
The pool was amazing and the staff were very attentive, courteous and friendly.
An easy 8-10 min walk to the main Seminyak strip and square, and there are also a couple of friendly bars along the way to break the walk up.
The shuttle service was excellent, as was the daily breakfasts served to our table within the villa.
The rooms themselves were clean and well-appointed with good air-conditioning. 

A couple of other points:
- Two people in our villa were got an electric shock from one of the lights in the deck - staff were made aware of this, although we are not sure if the issue was resolved. 
- We organised for fencing to be placed in the villa to seperate the pool areas for our infant. This was done prior to us arriving, however the fish pond, right next to the dining area was still left exposed. The staff organised for a fence to be placed here once we told them. No issue with this; just something for reception to remember for future guests.
title: Fantastic villa in Seminyak

owner_response.text:
Dear Chua K ,

Thank you for reviewing The Layar - Designer Villas and Spa here on TripAdvisor.

We would like to highlight your comment that our villa is pretty modern and nice. Also for staff who are very friendly and courteous.

We apologise for the Wi-Fi issues you have experienced during your stay with us. Since you left we understood the source of instability: our trees have been growing in past year and were partially covering some antennas. Therefore we raised those antennas about 2 meters and the connection is now more stable in any villa.

We are sorry to hear you experienced discomfort with our aircon. We take any comment very seriously as our guest comfort is top priority. Also we maintain regularly aircon cleaning filters quarterly and checking gas pressure monthly to avoid any issue. We have checked the aircon in villa 16 and they resulted in good working order. March has been incredibly hot this year and this impact aircon efficiency. We are however considering increasing the capacity in some villas. Thank you for bringing this to our attention.

We are glad to hear that you enjoyed your last day at villa 10 made available for you as free late check out.

Thank you for having time to write this review on TripAdvisor. Please feel free to contact our GM on gm@thelayar.com  or me fom@thelayar.com

text:
We just got back from a few nights at the Layar.  We loved the villa, its just stunning.  The staff are very friendly.  We had a three bedroom villa with different couples and the layout was very private, and being in the pool it felt very private too.  Very well maintained.  Housekeeping staff are good.  Good location.  My expectations were high as its a high level of luxury with an equivalent price tag attached.

We enjoyed and would defrinitely consider coming back. A few little things annoyed me, such as the wifi not working in the downstairs bedroom, or the breakfast NEVER arriving on time and causing us to be late for tours etc, or the fact there isn't a phone in the main area when you want to call the buggy, or the fact we kept bumping our shins in the weird bed design, or the fact we asked for a tour to be booked and the lady at the front desk just never booked it (luckily we checked the night before and the guy at the front desk pulled a miracle) but overall incredibly nice and unless a property of equal property was cheaper such as one eleven, we'd stay here again.
title: Excellent

owner_response.text:
Dear EmBMav ,

Thank you for reviewing The Layar - Designer Villas and Spa here on TripAdvisor.

We would like to highlight your comment that you loved the villa and its just stunning. Also for the staff  who are very friendly.

We appreciate your feedback that The Layar - Designer Villas and Spa is very well maintained and very private also located in good location.

We apologise for the Wi-Fi issues you have experienced during your stay at The Layar - Designer Villas and Spa; we’ve found out the repeater we use to cover the downstairs bedroom was faulty. Also, we must admit that has been a complicated week for our breakfast delivery team due to heavy rains. An alternative many guests appreciate is to consume breakfast at our restaurant Settimo Cielo, a good chance to experience food straight from the kitchen rather then delivered by buggy.

We provide phone in each bedroom for the guest use. However, we take your feedback seriously and consider to add extra phone in the public area for guest convenience.

We would like to clarify about the tour, a boat transfer from Bali to Lombok in fact. In this case, we did gather all information regarding price and schedule for you but for two consecutive days the reception had no chance to speak with you to obtain a confirmation, so all was on hold, and as such not in our system; hence the staff who answered your call initially could not retrieve your booking. The miracle therefore was just to confirm your pending booking, which we managed to do even at night. We apologise however for the inconvenience you have experienced.

We are glad to hear that you definitely consider to coming back.

Thank you for having time to write this review on TripAdvisor. Please feel free to contact our GM on gm@thelayar.com  or me fom@thelayar.com

The villa is stunning beautiful however it is showing serious signs of wear and tear. 
Things that went wrong include rowdy drunken neighbour that screamed and party throughout 2 nights, power trip on third night, unavailability of buggy after 6pm, dirty day bed (felt itchy just lying on it), choked toilet, faulty flush and not hot water in shower. However the redeeming factors for the hotel are prompt services (security to shut the neighbour and solve power trip), generally above average service and awesome breakfast in the villa. owner_response.text:
Dear TypicalSgporean ,

Thank you for reviewing The Layar - Designer Villas and Spa for other readers here on Tripadvisor.

We would like to highlight your comment about our awesome breakfast and above average services. Also for our prompt services to solve the noise problem due to the neighbor and the power trip.

We always put our guest comfort as priority and will do our best to ensure that our guests have memorable moment during stay with us, sometime though people on holiday exceed in night celebrations, and we normally intervene rapidly, as happened in your case. We would like to highlight our policy on the subject is music in villas should be kept at a very low level (i.e. non audible from neighbors) after 10PM.  We apologies this has caused to you a major inconvenience.

We would like to clarify the our buggy drop off service is available from 9AM to 6PM, as written on the welcome letter that we send to our guest upon arrival. However, we normally extend the drop off hours upon guests request if a butler is available.

Our housekeeping regularly clean up the villa including the daybed. However, there was a windy rain during your stay with us, that brought some from the roof to your day bed, an exceptional occurrence. We would like to highlight that house keeping cleaned up the day bed once the rain finished. There was also a blackout from the state electric company on the third night of your stay and we managed to activate our back up power accordingly, and rapidly as you confirmed.

We also apologise for the failure equipment in the bathroom. It was out of our control. However, we thank you for letting us know immediately so we can fix them accordingly.

Thank you for having time to write this review on TripAdvisor. Please feel free to contact our GM on gm@thelayar.com  or me fom@thelayar.com

text:
We stayed in a villa for 8 nights and we loved everything, from the pool to the bathroom, from the room to the kitchen, from the living room to the dining room, the design is beautiful and functional.

The location is reasonable - 5 min walking distance form Seminyak main road and 15min from the beach. They have a buggy service to take you to these places until 6pm but normally there is only one available which is insufficient to accommodate all guest on busy hours so don't count on it to watch the sunset at the beach because you will most certainly loose it. But outside the rush hours the service works well. 

We loved the breakfast, healthy and well presented and always delivered on time and still warm.  

Wifi was very good at all times and the sound system was super, however we cannot comment on the tv's (one in the bedroom and one in the living room) because we never tried turning them on.

There were however a few things we did not like.

The top one was the constant calls from the staff to ask us if we wanted this or that, and once when we had the "please do not disturb sign" hanged on the door, they called us to ask if, although we had the do not disturb sign hanged, they could come over to refill a coffee capsule!!! So we ended up taking the phone off the hook! But this did not solve the problem... with the sign do not disturb hanged outside and with the phone off the hook, they entered the villa to deliver breakfast two days in a row without even knocking on the door! Unfortunately there is no door bell and the door has no locker on the inside otherwise we would have used constantly.

General cleaning was not that good but still acceptable.

Notwithstanding the staff being over-attentive, they are very kind and helpful.
Apart from the negatives, the positives are so good I still recommend these villas.
title: Stunning Villa, Staff overatentive

text:
We stayed in a two bedroom villa at The Layar from 14th to the 28th September this year and found it to be the most amazing place we have ever stayed. It had an instant WOW factor for us and we have stayed at many five star resorts.
When we arrived we were struck by the amazing design of the villas and the wonderful aspect of indoor/outdoor living. Everything in the villa was of the highest standard and highest quality. 
The staff were exceptional. So friendly and genuinely happy to help with any request we had. The breakfast service was prompt and always as we had requested. We always popped into reception in the evening to order our breakfast for the next morning, instead of ordering over the phone when called by the staff, as we usually made changes to the standard options. Our changes were usually complicated but always carried out to our requirements. 
The housekeeping staff came in every day after either a phonecall from reception or called from the gate intercom. They arrived as a team each having individual tasks and performed these tasks quickly and efficiently with minimum intrusion. Always with a friendly smile and greeting. The villa was always spotless with towels changed daily and bed linen every two days.
The butlers were happy to help with anything and everything we asked for, from dropping off in Seminyak Square by buggy to giving a tour of the villas on site. The Staff in reception were extremely welcoming and friendly no matter what time of day or night and dealt with any request efficiently. Even the security guards were friendly and cheerful when leaving or entering the complex.
It is apparent that this is more like a family than just a place to work. The whole team work very well together from front of house to back of house.
I wish we could name everyone individually but this would be so unfair to the people who were unseen by us but still contributed to our enjoyment here.
We loved our stay here so much that we actually booked for next year before we left this year. 
ABSOLUTELY FANTASTIC !!!!!

Terima kasih banyak
Mr Brian & Mrs Lynn
Scotland
title: Superb Stunning Resort

text:
We stayed at The Layar for 8 nights in a 3-bed villa. Not cheap, so our expectations were high.

POSITIVES
Staff were friendly and helpful. 
The villa was amazing. Beautiful design and layout. Great pool. 
They have buggies to take you as far as Seminyak Square when you want to venture out.

NEGATIVES
The water in the outdoor jacuzzi isn't heated and it was freezing cold. So cold we couldn't ever use it. Looks great, but that's it!
One of the bathrooms had a bad mosquito problem that wasn't alleviated by the regular fogging that takes place.
There was an awful smell underneath the kitchen sink. Truly awful.
The baths filled with grit and dirt when they were drained after use. Clearly there is a problem with the drainage. This might explain the mosquito problem too - they like stagnant water.
Communication - there is no doorbell or intercom,so staff bang on the door or shout when they arrive. Or get reception to call you. Then you have to get up to let them in. This could be easily solved by a buzzer that you can carry around with you to let people in. Might not sound like much of a problem, but believe me, you get a lot of staff interaction!
There's a great coffee machine in the villa, but they only give you instant coffee.
We found the food to be distinctly average. Breakfast is over-fussy and over-complicated. Salt doesn't flow from salt pot. We tried everything and nothing hit the spot. Nothing tastes as you would expect! Weird bacon, weird sausages, weird muesli. And the weirdest toast ever - greasy and chargrilled. In fact everything felt greasy and heavy. They also wash the napkins with the kitchen cloths because they smell.....greasy. We ended up skipping breakfast altogether about three times. 
On one occasion, I ordered a curry with rice. The curry arrived about 45 minutes later without the rice. They told me the rice would be 3 minutes when I asked where it was. After the waitress left, I tasted the curry and it was cold. I called to tell them, and was advised to reheat it in the microwave!!! We're paying a fortune to stay here and we have to reheat our own food! I objected, and they came to collect the cold food. In hindsight, I should have refused, because it meant they just went off and reheated it themselves!

I so wanted to give The Layar five stars because the villa was simply stunning. They're doing pretty much everything right, but need to spend some time problem solving to justify the price tag. At this price point every last detail matters. And other places do it better.
title: Beautiful villa. With issues.

text: Stunning accommodation in Seminyak. We were thorough impressed with how beautiful and clean The Layar was during our visit. Staff were excellent in catering to our requirements, the level of service was perfect . We did not want to leave

text:
This is a beautiful villa compound in a surprisingly excellent location in Seminyak (close to most restaurants, bars, cafes and beach clubs). 

The villa itself is immaculately presented and very roomy. The layout, from the sunken lounge to the pool to outdoor bathrooms, is very well considered. We were in a group of 3 couples and the 3-bed villa was perfect. 

Although the staff are friendly and attentive, they can interrupt too frequently. The phone in your villa would ring about a dozen times every day with different requests. A small complaint, but one that could prove tiresome to couples seeking peace and quiet...

Against the excellence of the villa was the very poor booking and reservation process prior to arriving. It was unprofessional and unlike anything I've experienced before - particularly for a 5-star property like this. 

Rather than simply charging your credit card, they insist on ++% fees or offer to accept your payment in USD. I went with the latter and was subsequently hit with $100+ "processing fee". 

Despite frequent phone calls, I received no satisfactory explanation to this - a very poor and frustrating start to the holiday. 

A great place to stay, but beware the fees!!
title: Poor reservation, excellent stay

owner_response.text:
Dear AntFisk, 

Thank you for reviewing The Layar - Designer Villas and Spa on Tripadvisor. 

We would also like to thank you for your kind remarks about our villas, we strive to ensure all our guests stays are enjoyable and to the highest possible standards.  

We apologize for the phone call interruptions during your stay with us;  upon check in we always inform our guests  that they will be called to select their breakfast order and ensure everything is satisfactory,  however if they do not require this service to tell reception, or place the ‘do not disturb’ sign on the villa gate. Apologies if the latter was not fully explained to you at the time.

We do feel the need to clarify your comments in regards to our standard published credit card charges and as per our discussions with you whilst at the villa.

On  our email correspondence we show a 2.99% handling fee that is applied to credit card payments received through our internet payment gateway or the other option is to pay the villa rental invoice by bank transfer where we charge no fees. However the banks may apply charges for the transfer which is what has happened in this case as the amount you sent us was short as per the invoice charged.

text:
Stayed in this villa for my family holiday in July 2015. The villa was spacious, clean and modern and the pool was excellent, and large enough to swim lengths. The staff were helpful and, whilst expensive, the in villa spa treatments were excellent. 

Overall our stay in Bali was extremely pleasant, however there were a couple of minor issues. There was a large number of mosquitos in the villa and by the end of the week my sister had 40+ bites, making lying by the pool slightly uncomfortable. As well as this, whilst the breakfast in the villa was delicious and well presented, the vegetarian options were slightly limited, resulting in having to have the same breakfast day after day.
title: Almost perfect...

owner_response.text:
Dear Amber M ,

Thank you very much for reviewing The Layar - Designer Villas and Spa here on Tripadvisor.

We appreciate your feedback that The Layar - Designer Villas and Spa is clean and modern and the pool was excellent, and large enough to swim lengths. Also for our excellent spa treatments.

We are sorry to hear about you sister’s problem with mosquitoes bites. Unfortunately mosquitoes are inevitable in a tropical climate like Bali. We do many efforts to anticipate this by doing mosquito fogging and pest control twice a week, which is done as discretely and fast as possible. The same do our neighbor resorts so that the area surrounding us is actually kept as mosquito-free as possible. However the effectiveness of this is at times limited by winds that can carry new mosquitoes from more distant lands. For this reason we do fogging also on guest request. We are sorry to hear about this just now  as we could have done more efforts to keep your villa free from those insects.

Our breakfast menu was designed to be comprehensive and provide a selection of high quality breakfast items, including a daily rotation of house pastries, fresh fruits, juices, imported coffees, yoghurts, egg dishes, healthy dishes, and Indonesian favorites. We consider to improve our breakfast selection by adding vegetarian menu  so we could have standards to suit people with specific dietary food. We strive to make every guests stay as memorable as possible.

Thank you for having time to write this review on Tripadvisor. Please feel free to contact our GM on gm@thelayar.com  or me fom@thelayar.com

text:
My husband and I, our three month old boy, and our friends and their three month old spent 8 nights at The Layar, in July, in a three bedroom villa. The service was absolutely outstanding. 

Having very small children we had bottles, formula, sterilizers, cots, the need for a lot of filtered water; plus we were aware of Mosquitos and the need to keep the kids away from them as much as possible. The guest services team could not have been more accommodating and more efficient. They organized car seats for the airport transfers, cots, and the villa kitchen had filtered water attached to the fridge dispenser. Each room had electric mosquito repellent pods as well. It was fantastic. 

All the staff were so friendly and accommodating, and loved the kids. We had in-villa massages and dining, all of which were beyond our expectations. Honestly, the food was exceptional (based on dining in Sydney's eastern suburbs and north shore). I highly recommend the in-villa BBQ one night as well. 

We used the butler service / concierge to book all our dining (lunch and dinner), and the staff went above and beyond to help us get the reservations we wanted. 

We also used the buggy service - complimentary - to get around Seminyak, which made things very easy.

I have never written a review on Trip Advisor, despite traveling regularly all over the world. However, this time it's a must; The Layar is a exceptional. We will be back; I can't imagine anywhere else could match them.
title: Outstanding stay
