text:
I stayed at the Layar back in May and I have been meaning to jump on here and write a review as it was hands down the best villa I have stayed in whilst in Bali. 

I was traveling solo and booked into a 1 bedroom villa and it was simply stunning. All the finishes throughout the villa were of a very high standard and the breakfast delivered to the villa each morning was delicious. 
The staff were all so lovely and accommodating, nothing was too much trouble for them. I phoned ahead to have fresh fruits and mixers in my villa and they were there on my arrival and very reasonably priced. 
The staff were in and out of the villa in a discreet and timely manner with daily cleaning and the villa was extremely clean upon check in. All towels and linens were clean and fresh.. 
I must say the staff and security were fantastic. Traveling solo, It was reassuring to have the 24hr security at the gate.

The location of the Layar is perfect with only a short stroll down to the Main Street. There is also a golf buggy service available which runs throughout the day down to Seminyak Square. 

All in all, I had an absolutely perfect stay at the Layar - the worst part about it was having to pack my suitcase to leave! I would not hesitate to recommend the Layar to any of my friends and family traveling to Bali, I will certainly be staying there again on my next visit.
title: Paradise

text:
Stayed at The Layar from June 10th, 2015 – June 14th, 2015
Very friendly, professionally trained staff which is very attentative and helpful. 
We aslo enjoyed the free buggy service from the hotel to the Seminyak town area or Ku De Ta restaurant (only drop off until 6pm and no pick up back to the hotel which was not a problem at all). 
The breakfast is simply gorgeous and there is something delicious for every taste. The food was immaculate!! 
Even though there are lush gardens in front of every bathrooms and the pool side there was not a big problem with mosquitos at all because the hotel does fogging twice a week (which is done as discretely and fast as possible; even if you are in the villa during that time just hide in the bedrooms for 10-15min). 
Overall a great experience and a relaxing holiday. Definitely recommended, worth every cent and hopefully we will be able to go back to this luxurious villa! 
Thanks to all the staff for making our stay such a memorable one!!

text: We stayed at The Layar in a 4 bedroom villa for 10 nights.  Breakfast was sometimes a challenge to order but always arrived on time, was delicious and beautifully presented.  We found the household staff to non intrusive and the reception staff go the extra mile to help with any request both large or small.   The buggy to 'Eat Street' was often used by us but it is literally a less than 10 minute walk and nearer to 5.  We had a late night flight and as our villa was booked, they provided another for us at no extra charge until our transport arrived at 6pm.  The villa and pool look exactly the same as the photos.  The beds and pillows are comfortable and the furnishings and decorations are to a high standard.  If you want your little bit of heaven away from the hustle and bustle but still close to all amenities, this is the place for you.

text:
I know there are some awesome reviews here but clearly we may be one those who had some high expectations. We were a big group - 7 couples, 8 kids and 7 nannies! we had 3 bedroom villas booked for two families. Firstly we go to Bali very often and most of our friends are from Indonesia. However even after we had made the payment there were a few things like a baby cot, extra mattress, high chair which we had requested. Now most places have it complimentary but this place loves to have a price for anything and everything.

We were one of the first families to check in and as all bookings were made by our friend at the time of check in we were asked to make payment or ensure the payment for the high chair and baby cot was made. not once but repeated 20 times! we get it. we are not running away, you have the credit card details.

Secondly, even though we had 4 villas..we were all spread out which made it difficult for us to bond or move from one villa to another. The range of the kids age was from 6 months - 7 years.

Some of the staff were fantastic..they were really helpful. But here are some of the things which concern us.

- Cleaning the villa was a pain. we had to call them all the time to have it cleaned specially coz we had little kids
- Breakfast was below average. I dont know what people thing but the eggs were below average and lets not go towards the coffee
- One of our rooms could only be accessed via the bathroom. as it was next to the living room, it was a major issue. Because everyone would go to that bathroom and if someone had to go to the room there isnt any other way!!
- Swimming pools were small but clean. nothing fancy
- Rooms were well fitted and beds were comfy but again not a 5 star feel.
- Staff came daily to get us to sign any mini bar or extra charges. one of the days they charged us 5 coffee pods and we said..guys we dont even use the coffee machine. From Day 1 it has been left in the kitchen cabinet and it may be a mistake. it took them 2 days to agree to waive it off. 5 coffee pods - layar isnt very expensive.

- As we had helpers we had to order food from them each day from outside. When we asked if they could help us.."It is not in our policy". Atleast help us with some names of places, we can order food or use a food delivery service.

Overall we just felt for the price we paid. we have had better experience in Bali. Dont get me wrong most staff were good but i think there is a lot of improvement required at their management and policy level.
title: Definitely not worth the Hype!

text:
We are staying at the Layar right now and it is a beautiful environment to be on holiday with young children. The pool is fabulous, the beds comfortable, the breakfast delicous and varied (and not cold when it arrives).

Our flight was cancelled at the last minute and meant we arrived a day late but The Layar were still there to meet our flight and whisk us off in air conditioned comfort to our villa. 5 stars - what a relief! They area also extremely helpful in making arrangements for us - babysitting, restaurants, golf, phone calls and booking taxis. Friendly and warm, unobtrusive and just as beautiful as we have come to find the Balinese. 

Unlike some venues, these photos are exactly as the villa is in real life and we would not hesitate to recommend it to others. Clean, new and fresh - and an elegant and soothing design.

We have another 5 glorious days and nights here so I will update my review as the time progresses.

text: We have just returned from 7 nights at the Layar Villas, Seminyak. We were in villa 5 which is the largest villa at the property with 4 bedrooms. The villa itself is huge, so much space and so private. The pool and living areas are also huge. No real complaints, we normally stay at The W, and although the Layar was not at the same level of service is was still pretty good. Couple of things around the villa could have been in better condition, however only minor things. Breakfast was fresh and flexible each day. Yes after day 4 or 5 the menu gets a bit familiar but there are so many places just up the road if you want a change. The spa facilities in your personal villa are very handy and we found the staff from the massage place next door the the layer happy to come to your villa to provide treatments. Much more affordable than the in-house service. Staff were attentive when you called, but maybe could have been less prompted. The privacy is nice, but having to call for room service and breakfast clean up became a chore. Would defiantly stay here again. Nearly forgot, we had the invite BBQ for 17 people and Dion and the team were excellent. It was set like a wedding at home, perfect. The food was excellent and lots of it. Nothing was a trouble. Only complaint and minor was the pickup. We had to call to have the table/chairs cleared would have been nice if staff turned up early to clear before we were up maybe. Great place, great location and friendly staff. Oh wifi was not great, worked but very slow and connection issues a lot of the time.
title: Bali 2015 - Villalyf

owner_response.text:
Dear  AzzaBMW,

Thank you for taking time to review The Layar - Designer Villas and Spa here on TripAdvisor.

Our 4 bedroom villa is built on 1,081 meter squares of land size with 430 meter squares building area and 86 meter squares of swimming pool. We appreciate your feedback that the villa is huge and in a great location with so much space and so private.

We are happy to hear that you have fresh and flexible breakfast each day. In July we will open a restaurant at the entrance of the resort, and this will add more choices for breakfast.

We normally send our FB service to clean up the dishes one hour after any food (breakfast or room service) has been delivered, and inform guests about that.  We apologize if one hour the service has not been timely, or your preference for a faster service has not been noted.

The Layar caters special BBQ event and other dinner functions in the villa. We provide special decorated table and chairs in the garden. We normally clear up everything when the event finish. However, our guests sometimes enjoy the drinks and talk with friends until very late around the chairs and tables that we provide for their special event. In this situation we normally let the guest spend their time together and clear up everything the next morning. It is sometime difficult to find the right balance between service and privacy.

We apologize for the Wi-Fi issues you have experienced during your stay at The Layar - Designer Villas and Spa. We have recently upgraded the Wi-Fi network with combined cable and wireless router to improve signal strength and stability.

Thank you for having time to write this review on TripAdvisor. Please feel free to contact our GM on gm@thelayar.com  or me fom@thelayar.com.

text:
I stayed for 2 nights in the 2br with my partner and another couple. Spacious rooms, cleaned brilliantly, one shower terrible but we asked them to fix it and it was done straight away. 

I agree with another review that bfast came once on time and once late and both times the food was cold. Great nice/fruit/pastries.

The biggest letdown is the lack of English at reception and they don't understand us!! The shuttle is only one way and at ridiculous times of the day but it is an easy walk to the main area (10 min) and the taxi is only $1 but always ask to start the meter or they will tell you minimum charge.

Would I stay here again?maybe but I am sure you can get a cheaper villa for similar standard.
title: Gorgeous but expensive

owner_response.text:
Dear Kipa74
 
Thank you for sharing your experience at The Layar - Designer Villas and Spa with other travellers here on TripAdvisor. 
 
We appreciate your feedback about our rooms being spacious and cleaned brilliantly.
 
Our staff is always ready to fix any unexpected or sudden failure of the villa equipment. 
 
We make clear on our website and to our guests that we provide buggy drop-off service and not a shuttle service.  The  service is currently available from 9 to 11AM, from 12 noon to 2PM and 4 to 6PM; we plan to increase operational times in the near future. 
 
Thank you for your feedback regarding your breakfast, very happy to hear that you enjoyed the pastries and fruit selection. On the other hand we regret to hear the problem with the timing of your breakfast (as per our records one day we mistakenly delivered at 7.40 and not 7.30) and the serving temperature of your meal: we do use pre-heated plates, and plastic covers reinforced with aluminium also heated, nonetheless having breakfast served directly in your villa is a small luxury and food temperature is a trade-off. Shortly we will open a restaurant at the entrance of the resort, so all guests will have the chance to choose to eat in restaurant, where breakfast is served meters away from the stove.  Your comments have been noted and shared with the kitchen and service team to ensure that we provide a better service in the future. Rest assured your comments have helped us grow.

We are surprised to hear about the poor English comprehension ability from our front office staff; all come from hotel school and have a fair ability; surely they are not native speakers and some incomprehension can happen, particularly with native speakers (i.e. New Zealander as in your case) whose standards are of course higher. We do apologize for any inconvenience caused. 
 
Thank you for having time to write this review on TripAdvisor. Please feel free to contact our GM on gm@thelayar.com  or me fom@thelayar.com
 
Best Regards,
Anton Budiono

text: We stayed at The Layar late March with my parents and our 3 children – 5 months, 3 and 5 years – and we had a fabulous time. The location of the villas is excellent – they do have a golf buggy that will drop you to Seminyak Square between certain hours but you can actually walk there in about 10 minutes. The layout of the villa is beautiful and all the furnishings are of a high quality. The design of the pool is perfect for children with 3 big steps leading to the deeper area and we paid the extra to have a pool fence installed. The landscaping is beautiful with a nice grass area for the kids to play. We experienced minimal noise from the other villas even though they were full. The service at the villa was exceptional from beginning to end – all the staff were delightful and couldn’t do enough to help. They were more than happy to book dinner for us each night and were very obliging answering any questions. You can book cheaper villas in the area but sometimes you get what you pay for and you certainly do at The Layar. Would definitely recommend The Layar and we plan to come back.

text:
I was recommended here by a friend of the owner who gave me a good and I wasn't going to write this review.  Until even after being pestered to fill in a questionnaire on departing waiting for the 1 hr late airport car, and my fairly negative comments, the sales manager STILL wrote asking me to review on Luxury Villas (but reserved the right to publish). So they can filter out the posts that aren't flattering.   So here we go as they can't filter this one.

The villa is right at the top of the price tree.  It's in a good location, the design is stunning, it's got a huge pool and that's it.  Maintenance, housekeeping, booking, bedding, a/c, breakfast timing - all epic fail.

Brekafast arrived three times out of 6 at the wrong time - once not at all, once cold, once only half of it.  

The air conditioning was so poor I slept on the floor two nights because the the room registered 22c (I have a Tissot divers watch that measure ambient temperature when off the wrist).  I asked for maintenance to check; 1st time they said, yes, low on gas.  It worked for 1 night.  After that, I don't honestly think they bothered.

The duvet cover has a ridiculous velcro fastener that comes undone right down the middle so you end up sleeping on Velcro edges.  I went to Carrefour and bought my own duvet on the 3rd day.

They say it's 0Km to Seminyak Square and they have a buggy service twice a day.  What they don't say is that it's actually nearly a kilometer to the square and the buggy service is one way.  So you have to walk back nearly a kilometre in 35c carrying your shopping.  

There is no doorbell so if housekeeping knock and you are in the closed bedroom area, you don't know.  So my friend was standing naked in full view in the shower and a little surprised to see someone from housekeeping had let themselves in and was clearing the dishes!

Winelist?  They had a single solitary bottle of overpriced white and a Chianti that had been stored too hot.  

The in room dining was excellent, really well prepared and presented by a talented chef somewhere in the back.  Shame the delivery and timing didn't match his skills.

This review will seem at odds with lots of other reviews; I'm simply relaying my experience as it happened and maybe I was just unlucky.  I hope so because there's a whole lot of changes that need to be made to justify the price and the building.
title: Great design, huge pool, housekeeping and maintenance hopeless.  Way too expensive

text:
We stay in a 3-bedroom villa which was simply lovely!  The staff were friendly and helpful, loved the welcome massages!  It's a wonderful place cos you can hang with your friends and still keep an eye on the kids in the pool.
If you want to have an adults nightout, you can employ their nanny services.
There's a buggy to bring you around Semniyak, which is useful as there are many good restaurants and cafes around the villa, e.g. Sardine, Potato Head Beach Club, Merah Putih, etc.
The breakfast was wonderful too, we were eggs benedicted out by the second morning, so we opted for the local breakfast on the third day, just as great.
Overall superb establishment.

text: My partner and I stayed at The Layar last August for his 30th birthday for 5 nights. I had booked a one bedroom villa but was pleasantly surprised with a two bedroom. The service was impeccable; wifi and bug spray was provided. Plus both worked which is always a plus. It is about a 10-15 min walk to the main areas which can be annoying (depending how lazy you are haha). Breakfast is provided in your villa every morning and it was incredible to wake up and eat by the pool. Our fave was the Indonesian choices. I also had a few spa treatments which I highly enjoyed. Would defs recommend staying here! Only thing to fault - our flight on our last day was at night and we just wanted to stay somewhere where we could relax. They were kind enough to spare us a villa for the day but we did have to pay the full rate... Perhaps we should have gone somewhere else for the day instead.

text:
A group of six of us rented the three bedroom villa for our second week of our Bali trip, and it was by far the best! Of course we you are their with a great bunch of people it does help, but the villa itself was stunning! It had ample space so that if you needed time on your own you could get away. The staff kept the cleaning to the highest standards, and answered our every need, helping us make reservations in some of Seminyak's most beautiful restaurants (even a late night maccas order) :)
My only negative was the breakfast/villa food, as it wasn't amazing we would eat out all the time, which is not a bad thing. However the staff informed us that they are building a restaurant at the front to better serve food (less chance of being cold by the time it gets to villa) which I think will be a fantastic asset to the villas.
All in all this place was incredible value for money and would definitely stay again. Hot tip- hire a moped to get around Seminyak as the daily free shuttle doesn't bring you back.
title: Amazing accommodation with friends!!

text:
There is not a bad word that can be said about Layar Villas.  A group of work colleagues booked three villas for a few nights.  After being met at the airport with transportation to the Layar in Seminyak, we arrived in the air-conditioned reception area.  Greeted with a cooling drink, all the necessary paperwork was dealt with, luggage and guests transported to our villas.  Our two bedroom villa had everything that we could have asked for - air-conditioned bedrooms, king beds, plush bathrooms, baths, kitchen, undercover eating and relaxing area, then another relaxation area, spa and pool.  Breakfast each morning was lovely, including some local fruit to go with either the Indonesian or European plates.
Staff were courteous and unseen unless needed.  Seven people to clean each villa felt a bit over-the-top on the first day, but we were soon used to such displays of excess service.
My only complaint?  That I was staying with work, and not with my wife.  Next time!
title: Superb.  As good as they are marketed to be.

owner_response.text:
Dear LeeHarvey,

text:
A group of us (friends) stayed in 2 x 3 bedroom villas in mid March. The two villas were sleek and aesthetically conscious, with palatial open living areas, indoor/outdoor bathrooms and large, (thankfully) well air conditioned, vast bedrooms. I think that this is the ideal accommodation arrangement for such a group given the layout - substantial areas to mingle, but also the ability to hightail it to one's room if the Madonna and fungal smoothie fuelled sessions get out of hand.  Which they didn't, of course. Ahem.

Although it suited us, the resort consists only of the villas themselves and a reception area.  Breakfasts were delivered to the villas and the selection was extensive - but as with all room service arrangements - suffered somewhat in consistency and timing.

Staff were polite and professional and the buggy service was greatly appreciated in the oppressive heat. 

In spite of the convenience, the extras were a little on the high side, basically Western hotel prices, including the laundry  - particularly considering there was a laundry just outside the gate charging substantially less - and the in-villa BBQ (way better off going to Sarong/Merah Putih/Sardine for the price, which was approx Rps 700k ++ not including drinks).

While not the be-all and end-all, the WiFi was also poor, although that wasn't an experience limited solely to this property.

All in all, an impressive property and particularly fit for purpose with a group of friends or if you want to be left alone.
title: Sleek, aesthetically driven and private cluster of villas

text:
Three of us had a wonderful stay at the Layar for three nights in Jan 2015. They have a clean and beautiful campus. Hospitality was great, staff is very friendly. The villa itself was very neat and clean with a nice interior design. The other thing that I liked was they give you complete privacy and don't interfere. Service is great - they can even go out and buy things for you if not available with them. They also have a Spa inside. You can call a masseuse at your villa, which is very convenient.

One thing that needs improvement is the internet connection. The wi-fi gets disconnected often and the speed is pretty slow. But overall, I think it is a great place to stay in Bali in this price range.
title: Amazing place!

text:
Everything was really good with our villa (no 11) from the moment we arrived. The staff were friendly and we really felt that they wanted to solve what small problems we had. Their free buggy service with a small golf car (9-11 am and 12-2 pm) to the restaurant and shop area of Seminyak was really useful since the short five-minute walk usually was enough to start sweating in the heat. Great housekeeping and a good breakfast served in the villa every day. They also provided us with a good guide when we wanted to do a full-day tour to the Ubud area. The pool was amazing and was used a lot to cool down. We ended up never going to the beach just becase the pool was so nice!

The design of the villas is very cool, but be prepared that the only air-conditioned areas are the bedrooms since there are no walls in the living room and actually only three walls in the bathrooms. We can't really decide what we thought of the bathrooms; the feeling of taking a shower outside was cool, but at the same time that meant that we had to share the bathroom with a few mosquitoes and the occasional lizard. 

Wifi connection was excellent in the living room but shaky or non-functioning in the bedrooms.

Our only real hiccup was that since we were staying six nights we expected the hotel to pick us up / drop us off at the airport for free but since we had not made the reservation through them directly that would instead cost 30 USD each way.
title: Our own oasis in Seminyak

text:
I stayed here with my family for my fathers 60th last week and didn't find many floors. If you wanted something(restaurant booking, taxi, car service) it was a phone call to reception away. We needed a doctor one night and they where at our door in 20mins from calling reception. 

The free shuttle service was great to get to Seminyak Square for us to use and leaving and arriving was always greeted by all staff we passed. 

The included breakfasts where good but the eggs need to be cooked less(this might be fussy but it's the little things you remember) as we found most of the time the poached eggs hard. We did go out for breakfast down near Seminyak Square at a place called Sisterfield and they had excellent food and an amazing lime and mint granita.

Some of the negatives are the inhouse prices for laundry and spa treatments. For the price of getting a shirt washed at the layar I could get roughly 7-8 items of clothing washed next door. Apart from the included head and shoulder massage I ventured else where to get my daily massage.

This is a great location to stay and would recommend it to anyone.
title: Great place to stay

text:
Before I begin what will be a very positive, glowing review of the Layar, I think an alternative view of Jim M's review is needed.  
We had the unfortunate 'pleasure' of staying in the villa directly opposite Jim M's.  The first night they arrived, we had to walk in to their villa late at night, to ask that they turn their blaring music down to a reasonable level - completely inconsiderate of all other guests.  As for the mosquito spraying - yes they came an informed us prior to spraying the villa grounds (it was not sprayed inside the villa as claimed) and yes, a small amount of smoke did drift into the villa - it cleared in 15 minutes.  Jim's recounting of this is so over dramatic and his reaction to the staff at the time was completely inappropriate.  The rudeness was all on his behalf, not the manager.  Yelling at the staff (we could hear the rant from our villa) & using the foulest language to people who were nothing but unfailing polite at all times.  Disgusting.
Our time at the Layar was exceptional, the villa was spacious, incredibly comfortable and such a relaxing environment.  It's not often that the actual facilities live up to the pictures used on booking / review sites, but The Layar certainly does - what you see is what you get ! 
The in house meals were of a much higher standard than we expected and the pricing is more than reasonable. Unlike another review, breakfast was never an issue for us, they always called the night before if we hadn't already placed our order, so never had to wait, it was always delivered at the time we requested.
The staff are sensational, incredibly polite, they went out of their way to accomodate any requests we had.  We didn't have any problems with wi-fi connections either - worked perfectly, in all rooms of the villa and the speed of the connection was fine.
Location is just an easy stroll from the main strip and everything in Seminyak is within walking distance.  And for those who are considering a massage but don't want to walk into central Seminyak, I can highly recommend Bodyworks right next door to the Layar - the services and staff are great !
I travelled with friends and we all agreed that we would return to the Layar without hesitation.
title: Perfection in every way ! And some corrections to a review below

text:
My partner and I stayed at The Layar recently with a group of friends. On first appearance it was a lovely hotel, with modern, beautiful architecture, very clean and friendly staff. However as we continued our stay with them we noticed several downfalls which made our stay very difficult. 

We were hosting a BBQ in the villa for 20 people which was advertised as $35 per head, however we were charged $110 per head for squid, steak, prawns and two salads. We received an absolutely absurd bill at the end of the trip and were being told to pay 3 times as much. We also discovered that they did not even provide us with half the amount of food as listed on the BBQ menu. The F&B Manager claimed that they used imported seafood which was why the price had gone up. However, this was not true. They offered us a mere 10% discount but it meant we still had to pay 2.5 times more. Wine was $100 per bottle which is also a ridiculously inflated price.
 
We were sharing our villa compound with another couple. We each had a key to our individual rooms however they would only supply one master key into the compound. This meant that we either all had to make sure we went to the villa together, that someone was always at the villa to let the others in or waiting at reception or at our front door for a member of staff to let us in. We did not have as much flexibility during our stay and waiting outside our villa to be let in was extremely frustrating and time wasting. 

All the villas had access to free wi-fi, however it was mind bogglingly slow and there were many occasions where it did not connect at all, especially in the bedrooms. To connect properly or at all you needed to sit in the communal area which was not always ideal.

The included breakfast was very basic. Elements were good but on the whole nothing special. If you did not order your breakfast the night before and ordered the morning you wanted to eat then you could be waiting for up to one and a half hours before getting it delivered to your villa. On two occasions they did not call us to ask for our order and were left with no breakfast in the morning. I would highly recommend going to a cafe or restaurant for breakfast.

We will not be returning to The Layar again.
title: An Unfortunate and Costly Experience

owner_response.text:
Dear Phoebe,
 
Thank you for writing review on this traveller community.
 
We are happy to hear that you love our modern, clean, and beautiful architecture villas together with friendly staff. 
 
We always provide the best possible services for our valuable guests here in our property, especially for group booking guests. All BBQ and in villa dining prepared for your group were pre agreed in all details ( menu – price ) via email from the leader of your group. We proposed our standard BBQ menus from 350 thousands up; however your group leader has requested a special Surf and Turf and confirmed the price quoted in writing. We think it is not quite fair to compare our lowest option standard menu versus special premium custom menu that we both have agreed.  Meals were consumed without any comment. All food agreed was served. Upon check out in front of your unexpected refusal to pay, the FB Director as a sign of goodwill, and in consideration of the fogging accident mentioned by Mr. Jim, granted a 20% discount  (not 10%). We are quite surprised to be now accused to charge triple price for a listed item – that would be actually a criminal offense! 
 
We would like to underline that the imported items were only Wagyu beef and Australian lamb chops. We have plenty of fresh seafood here in Bali; no imported seafood was served nor did we claim to have.

Travellers who often visit Bali will understand that imported wine in Indonesia is subject to 300% tax. At The Layar we offer a selection of reasonably priced wines, mainly from Italy and South Africa. Your group leader however requested pre-arrival a specific Sauvignon Blanc from New Zealand that we do not have in menu. We sourced it wholesale and offered it with a mere 20% mark-up. You might know that by law we have to add a further 21%  tax and service charge. We are confident the price pre tax and service was same as in wine shop in Bali. 
 
I personally think that giving many gate keys to guests will cause another complication at the end. We have a very simple and efficient way to manage this by letting our guest leave the gate key at reception. The bedroom key is up to the guests whether they want to keep at reception or bring with them outside for privacy reason. We have butlers and receptionists that stand by to open the gate just in case guests are separated from others. We will however consider your feedback on this.
 
We apologize for boggling and dropped connection you have experienced in your villa. However, we have engineering staff that available twenty-four hours to restart the router and assist you for wi-fi issues. Each villa has its own wi-fi repeater located in the living room but all rooms receive signal as well, at times with specific repeaters. 
 
We always recommend our guests to order breakfast the day before to provide better service. We serve breakfast in the villas, a small luxury not all resorts offer. You might easily understand we cannot serve 23 villas at the same time, therefore our invitation to book the time the day in advance. Butlers call all villas to remind this and collect breakfast orders the late afternoon before; not everyone picks up the phone though. We do not call in the morning, guests might be sleeping. If guests do not call for breakfast, either the day before or the morning, we will not disturb them bringing a breakfast of our choice. I guess this is pretty standard and understandable.
Thank you for having time to write this review for all of travellers here on Tripadvisor. Please feel free to contact our GM at gm@thelayar.com or FB Director fbd@thelayar.com or me fom@thelayar.com
owner_response.title: Tanggapan Pemilik

text:
The one thing I find inexcusable it they almost killed us by fogging our unit with a nasty and horrible mosquito repellant. Fogged the whole place so dense you could not see 1 foot in front of your face... They did this while we were taking day naps. They did not bother to check and see if anyone was in the unit. We woke up to a horrible smell and thinking we were going to die. I was unable to see well enough to get our of my room so I had to honker down with a towel over my face for 15 minutes till I could get out. Eyes burning and felt very sick. Upon calling the manager to let them know what happened they were unapologetic, made excuses and tried to blame it on a misunderstanding on our part. All they needed to do was knock on the doors. They said "we called and no one answered so we did not think anyone was there".... Well, when you fog a villa to this level there is no excuse for putting your guests lives at risk. They claim it was "harmless chemical" which I don't believe after feeling sick for a day with burning eyes...  Our other guests in villa had to literally climb a concrete call to get out or they very well may have taken in so much repellant they could have died. AND THEY TRIED TO BLAME THIS ON US.... Manager was boderline rude and did not really seem to care. No true apology. They only thing they did for us was change our bedding that was soaked in the nasty gas. And they use a machine that spits out petrol/gas into the unit while doing the spray as well that is FOR SURE toxic. And they do it INSIDE your villa to a level in US where they would tent your home and ensure no one was inside and triple check that.
Food here is not good. "crispy bacon" is a wilted piece of fat. 
To be fair, the villas are nice. And the staff was very kind (minus the manager who did not seem to care that he almost killed us)...
The beds are not good and very hard. Gave us all neck issues every morning when we woke up.
Private dinners in your villa are overpriced and they will overcharge you for them so make sure to be very clear on your deal for this if you decide to stay here and do a private dinner.
Pools in villas are nice and landscaping is nice. Also the people who work front desk are nice and helpful. However the "butler" you are supposed to receive is not a butler at all. Just means you have someone you can call at front desk to come help you. A true butler is there to focus on you and help you with your every need and why places are called 5 star. But that is not what you get. 
I really wanted to give this place a 4 star review, it is 100% NOT a 5 star resort by any means. I have stayed at many true 5 star places and this does not qualify or even come close. If we had not had mosquito incident and the food was not poor I would have given 4 starts.... Some very nice people work here... But after the incident we experience and the way the manager really did not seem to care I have to give it a 3. Wanted to give it a 2 but feel it is not worthy of a score that low. 3 stars is what this place is, it's OK, but nothing that special. We had a good time, place was decent, but I'd stay somewhere else next time I come to Bali. I REALLY WANTED TO RECOMMEND THIS PLACE! But the last few days things went downhill and to have woken up to a villa filled with mosquito repellant and gasoline fumes made me unable to do so. And as I said, the room service food is quite poor.
title: decent place but lots of issues as well - NO WAY IS THIS A 5 STAR HOTEL

owner_response.text:
Dear Jim,
 
Thank you for sharing your experience with Tripadvisor readers.
 
We would like to highlight your feedback that our villas and landscaping are nice and the operational staff was very kind. Especially the people who work at front desk are nice and helpful. 
 
We are really very sorry about the accident with fogging. Our common practice of fogging is providing written notification on living room table the day before and remind the guests in the morning of fogging day. We fog common grounds and villas’ gardens; we never fog inside the villa. We also push the door phone and call the guest inside that we are going to do fogging in the villa gardens. We do not fog villa gardens if a guest ask us so.  
We would like to clarify that we did talk with a lady in your group and she confirmed that we could come in for fogging. I personally think that this is a miscommunication matter that caused understandable surprised reaction from your side. We do not use harmful chemical. Our fogging company partner has certification for the substances that they use in our property. They perform fogging in countless resorts in Bali and over Indonesia. Of course, one should not be exposed to the fogging directly, and personnel performing always use protective masks.
We apologize for the inconvenience at your end.  We appreciate your suggest in our earlier conversation to be strict and not allowing guest stay in the room during fogging progress even though they insist to do so. 
 
We are sorry for the impression that you got when the manager apologized and tried to explain the situation. There was no intention to blame anyone from our side. 
 
We set up bed pad and comforter for each bedroom in the villa. We are happy to put extra layer of comforter if you need bed adjustment that meet your requirements. Unfortunately we did not hear about this during your stay. 
 
It is a surprise for us that you wrote our catered lunch and dinner menus are overpriced while we both know that your group leader prior to arrival had confirmed all prices and menu. All we did just follow the arrangement that has been confirmed in writing. We explained this in detail in our reply to your fellow group member Ms. Phoebe.
 
We really appreciate your feedback regarding our food. We have recently hired an Italian chef and have improved our selection of menus and we will launch brand new food and beverage menu in the upcoming week. 
Thank you for having time to write this review for all of our readers and reviewers. Please feel free to contact our GM at gm@thelayar.com or FB Director fbd@thelayar.comor me fom@thelayar.com
owner_response.title: Tanggapan Pemilik

text:
We stayed at The Layer (Villa #15) early September for nine nights with my daughter and two grandchildren one 3 1/2 and one 8 months - could have stayed longer, did not want to leave.

The Villas are absolutely stunning and beautifully set out. The pool is amazing and the gardens just beautiful. Spent most of the day at the Villa soaking up the sun by the pool.

The location is perfect, we were able to walk to all the great restaurants in Seminyak.

We had one night of very noisy neighbours @ 1:00am. Staff dealt with this promptly.

A big thank you to all the staff  for the fantastic stay we had, the service and security was just
amazing.The butlers, cleaners and gardeners did a wonderful job.

We will certainly be coming back again, I would not even consider looking elsewhere. Highly recommend to others, you will not be disappointed.

As for the mosquitos well what can you do, it's not the staffs' fault.The rooms are sprayed daily and once a week outside the villas is treated too. The mosquitos were bad in Legian also. Suggest you buy plenty of spray and repellent.

Loved it, loved it, loved it

text:
We stayed in The Layar mid August for 5 nights. We booked a two bedroom villa for two adults and two children.

The villas are absolutely stunning, the design and architecture has been well thought out for outdoor living. The villa remained cool in the shade and provided more than ample space for our family. A separate kitchen, dining area, TV area and living area plus two bedroom and bathrooms. Throughout the stay, we remained mostly at the villa as we just wanted to relax. The pool was big enough for the boys to have a good swim, it was around 2M deep at one end but had a shallow end too.

Initially, we were placed in a villa next to construction noise, when we complained, we were moved within 24 hours to another similar villa. This was really well organised and excellent customer service.

Timing of room service is hit and miss - we were told there was a staff shortage in the kitchen most days, we had to wait over 2 hours one evening and there was no communication from the kitchen, we had to keep calling. However, staff and managers were very apologetic and we had several visits from management to make sure things were ok. You get to select your breakfast every day and there were small errors but staff were very helpful and really wanted to please.

Pros: huge villa, lovely pool, stunning bathrooms, excellent privacy with plenty of foliage around the villa, great surround sound system, good quality food, good housekeeping services - the villa was very clean and the staff were attentive when they did clean, ample breakfast

Cons: NO SPA or GYM, this was a major let down. They provided a spa service in your villa (around £25 compared to £4 outside the villa). They say that this is in line with equivalent hotels around Seminyak but how can they justify spa fees without a spa? 

Location: the villas are around 10 minutes from a busy high street with lots of shops and places to eat, so that was very convenient. Food is very cheap outside so do consider going out.

We had a good experience because the staff and management tried very hard to rectify the any issues. I think that the staff are key to this place being a success or failure as the properties are stunning. We did feel that the service was personalised to us and that was brilliant, however, there is a lack of professionalism in the streamlining of their services so not quite 5 star really, that's why I gave it 4 star as services can be a little hit and miss sometimes.

Well done to all the housekeeping staff though, they did a great job!
title: Stunning villas, but need to work on services provided

text:
My family are I (mum, dad and 2 little kids) have been coming to Bali since 2014. We have stayed in many hotels and other villas, other than the unfortunate time when the borders were closed during Covid. 

Living in Australia, Bali is our destination of choice. But with so many options to choose from, it’s difficult to ascertain where the ideal place is to stay.

After 7 trips with my family, I can with confidence highly recommend The Layar Villas.

There are many reasons for this:
24/7 whats app service with a 5 min turnaround for your every need
The most unbelievable management team and equally competent staff who are skilled in the art of 5 star service - nothing is too much to ask
My young daughter (now age 9) picnicked up a bout of Bali Belly and was unwell. The Villa Management team arranged an emergency doctor within 30 minutes on site. The dr and his nurse stayed with us for 3 hrs to ensure our daughter was hydrated with a drip, given anti nausea medication and an antibiotic for her quick recovery. The nurse dispensed the meds on site in our Villa - no need to even leave the kids room in our villa. I have been to a 5 star hotel in Bali where my elderly dad fell ill - it took over 2 hours to get a doctor and another few hours for medication. As parents, we were extremely impressed with the 5 star way the Layar Villas handled our own medical situation.
Location - brilliant location in Seminyak with so many fantastic safe to eat at restaurants nearby
In villa massage and spa service at state far more affordable than at any other luxury resort and hotel I have stayed at in Bali
Convenience of boutique service with only 23 villas - ensuring no need for large crowds, Covid safe and ;ots of privacy
On site 24/7 security with nightly patrols
Convenience of 24 hr personalised butler service
Amazing set up within the 2-bedroom villas - ideal for a family with lots of privacy
Weekly fumigation of vegetation in Villa garden to keep mosquitos way 
Twice daily housekeeping service for morning room clean and evening turn down
Barbecue at your villa whenever you’d like - they bring the bbq, prepare the meal fresh, cater for dietary requirements (our son is Celiac and gluten intolerant)
Amazing breakfast each morning in the quaint air conditioned restaurant - al a carte menu ensures no covid concerns of a buffet
Amazing large rims and massive space on the site on each villa
Attention to detail is everywhere including cutting vegetation around the pool in our villa so there is constant share at the hottest part of the day 
Gym nearby
Laundry service at a very reasonable rate - drop off in the morning at reception and its delivered to your villa by the afternoon
Golf cart transport for those less keen to walk to the reception and restauarant - or for those not keen on walking in the humidity 
Arranging safe blue bird taxi’s directly to our villa whenever needed

I would highly recommend this resort for those wanting to the best of both worlds - 5 star service like in a hotel but boutique service and huge villa accomodation in a highly personalised setting
title: Luxury in Bali with amazing 5 star service

text:
In the second half of November till December 7, 2022 my wife and I stayed in villa 15 of the Layar in Bali.
It was a fantastic treat.
The villa has been designed by an architect who understands his profession: making optimal use of the space(s), two large, beautiful bedrooms, both with very spacious bathrooms including shower and large round baths. It has a huge open living and the swimming pool is located in the middle of the beautiful garden, where the jacuzzi is located too. Many songbirds and squirrels also enjoy the garden!
Sometimes there were some mosquitoes bothering us, but an easily obtainable bottle of Soffell quickly took care of that.
There is a new large TV in the cozy mezzanine, just like one in each bedroom.
The staff does their job unobtrusively well. The beds are neatly made every day, the towels and bath towels and bed linen are replaced in time or on demand and the garden, the swimming pool and the entire house are also cleaned daily. The coffee, tea and drinking water are always replenished.
If you want you can go to a good Italian restaurant at the entrance of the complex. Of course you can also have breakfast, lunch or dinner delivered to your villa.
The villa complex is well guarded, safe and quiet (!), next to the shops on the road that leads to the more touristic part of the village: 'eat street’, where are many shops, restaurants, cafes. Something to suit everyone’s taste.
A very, very nice stay indeed, we can recommend it to everyone!
title: A fantastic treat in a beautiful and comfortable villa in Seminyak

text:
This is a late review, but better late than never. 
My husband and I stayed at the Layar in September 2019 for 6 nights. 
We were very pleased to be upgraded to a 2 bedroom villa from a 1 bedroom villa when we checked in, we ended up staying in Villa 11. 

The villa had beautiful gardens and a large pool and deck area. 
The living area is open with ceiling fans and the 2 bedrooms are airconditioned. This is very obvious from photos - not sure why people complain about this - if its an issue then book elsewhere. We found the space breezy enough for this not to be a problem and not be too hot. 
The nature of the gardens and Bali is that occasionally there were some insects and frogs around - this is not a problem. 

Overall the design of the villas is fantastic, and the gardens lovely but the villa was showing its age a bit. 

The main issues were maintenance things that need to be updated - the kitchen drawers and cupboards had a moist mouldy odour and some of the drawers etc couldn't be closed properly. 
We didn't use the TVs - they really should upgrade to smart TVs with Netflix access (not sure if this has been done now). 
The bedding/mattresses were a little old and had a few stained areas and were needing upgrading. 
The spa in the pool did not work - no bubbles for us. 

Breakfast was served daily in the villa but needs to be ordered by a certain time the previous day, ie if you don't order it you miss out. You also have the option of taking breakfast in their restaurant. Breakfast was reasonable, with varied options. Coffee provided was simply made using the plunger etc already in the villa. Espresso coffee would be great and is probably served in the restaurant but we ended up just having breakfast in the villa each day. 

We had one afternoon where the entire villa areas were smoked/sprayed? for insects/mosquitoes but had fair warning that this was happening and to stay inside the bedroom area. 

The location was reasonable, walking anywhere in Seminyak is a bit difficult on the roads and dodging motorbikes but relatively easy to walk down to shops, restaurants and the beach. There is apparently a buggy transport service around Seminyak but staff weren't particularly communicative about this. We didn't use this service. 

We had to pay extra for a late check out due to a late flight but this option was appreciated.
title: Great villa and location, just needing some maintenance

owner_response.text:
Hello olivedarcy,

Thank you for your generous review on Tripadvisor.

We take your feedback seriously in regard to some issues related to maintenance.  We just refurbished some villa units to make sure all equipments and building quality return to the highest quality.  We have also replaced all LCD TV with larger LED Smart TV to keep up with the standard of hospitality industry. 

We appreciate your constructive feedback and hope to have you stay with us again in the future. 

Kind regards,
Anton B - FOM

text:
In April we have experienced an unforgettable holiday with friends in Villa 15 of The Layar. Villa 15 is a very beautiful and almost overwhelming design villa that forms part of a luxury resort, right in the heart of Seminyak. Bali's best-known restaurants are within walking distance, as are boutiques, galleries, gourmet shops and a broad choice of other stores. If we didn't want to eat outdoors, we could still enjoy great food all day long, with a breakfast menu that was available from 7 to 11am. We even had the option to hire a private chef who advised a specially tailored menu for us to enjoy 'at home' in our villa.
Petitenget Beach is just a stone's throw away, where we had a good time chatting with friendly locals. It is clear to us why this beach is famous for its surf breaks and sunset bars.
Because we are golf enthusiasts, we indulged ourself here. After all, the most beautiful golf courses can be found in Bali. We loved the courses; it is like playing golf in a botanical garden, especially at Bali Handara. The disadvantage of that course however, is that it is not as near as the other courses.
Every time we entered our villa, we were impressed by the beautiful architecture and interior, combined with its open concept roofs. The villa is landscaped with a beautiful private garden, a large swimming pool, a kitchen and it has two spacious bedroom suites. Each bedroom has an en-suite bathroom with complete privacy and air conditioning. Our bed was very comfortable and we enjoyed very much the private garden shower that connects to the guest bedroom. The design, location and five-star service provided by the resort staff made sure we had a wonderful time.
This villa offered all the luxury of privacy, personal space and experience away from the crowds we could expect. It was a safe and wonderful place for an unforgettable holiday for us.
title: An unforgettable holiday!

text:
Villas are at least 10++ years old and poor maintained. Spider webs everywhere and found a big one in our room. Showers are mostly outdoors and the wood on the floors are falling apart. Service staff are extremely slow which might be because they are short handed. Toilet bowl requires you to press for 5-6 seconds to flush. One of the rooms toilet bowl broke down two days in a row. 

There’s a lack of Aircon in the living room which causes you to run into the Aircon rooms instead of lounging with your family in the living area. 

WiFi is barely working and the room TV’s are just for show, not working.

You’re better off picking a better maintained villa somewhere else. 

Location deserves a point but nothing more than that.

owner_response.text:
Dear 941ravinderk

Thank you very much for taking the time to review us on TripAdvisor for your recent three days stay in villa 8 and 20. It seems you didn’t pay too much attention while booking with us on Agoda since you were surprised to find out that our living rooms are not airconditioned; I would not define this as a “lack of” since this is a characteristic feature from our awards winning Italian architects: our villas are design for the indoor/outdoor living Bali is famous for, and to have a natural ventilation thanks to flow-through breeze complimented by ceiling fans. This is clearly visible from many photos on Agoda. 

However, upon your complain, our staff showed you villa 20 that has an extra-large air-conditioned TV room also with view of garden and you happily accepted to move. We did not hear any more complain from you so we are quite surprised now to read this mind-blowing list of issues. While there is surely space for improvements ins some areas you mentioned, I will refrain to comment further in details as it seems your review is biased by your un-met expectations of an enclosed air-conditioned villa. However I would like to state that we are fully staffed, we are running at a very high occupancy and I witness daily guests leaving fully satisfied (TripAdvisor seems no more a favourite for reviews but many recent ratings are available on Google), we pride ourselves to invest considerable money in maintenance which we have increased in this post pandemic reopening. 

Kind Regards, Anton Budiono, FOM

text:
Booked a 3 bedroom villa with another family. Whilst the villa is nice and strategically located, the service is appalling.

The rooms were dusty when we first checked in, had to borrow a broom to sweep our rooms.

The linen smells.

They provide you with a whatsapp number for communication but any msges after 5pm every day will only be replied the following morning at 9am, what happens if there is an emergency late at night? The provide another number for you to call but that didn't help when something happened on our last night which I will explain later.

Staff comes over for housekeeping after 12pm.

Breakfast selection is limited and the food was mediocre at best.

We requested for our breakfast to be served at 6.30am on our last morning because of an early checkout. Person in charge said it can't be done because the chef only starts at 7am and can only serve our breakfast at 7.45am. She even sent us a screenshot of their conversation to prove that the chef can't cook so early. Why is there even a need for validation? It was a simple request! 

On our last night, the air conditioner in my room died at 1am. I called the number provided by the management, hoping someone can attend to our emergency. Turns out that number connects us to the security guard. Told the guard what happened and he said "try turning it back on again with the remote control" I told him the problem is not with the remote but with the air conditioning and how are we suppose to sleep without one? He said he doesn't know anything and he will call someone from the management and he will call me back. Nope, that call never happened. I couldn't go back to sleep and we had to take the clothes off our young children because the heat was unbearable. 5 star villa indeed.

Why is there no one from the front office who can help us in the middle of the night? Complained to the whatsapp number and i suggested to them to have someone on standby who can help when such problems arise. I don't expect someone to find the air conditioner late at night but at least someone who could provide solutions, like a standing fan? 

They said they have someone on standby and that is the security guard. Isn't that a given?? How is the security guard gonna help with such problems??? Again they said the front desk staff only work until 5pm because of the safety protocols during this pandemic.

This only proves 1 thing.

You are in our care till 5pm. Anything after that, you will have to soldier through the night and hopefully make it till 9am the following morning to whatsapp for help. 

Take your money elsewhere, we are clearly not their priority.
title: Thank you, next!

owner_response.text:
Dear 384melvine,

We are disappointed to hear that your experience with us was not to your expectations.  Like most hospitality business's operating during this pandemic we have reduced some of our services to lower our costs in order to continue operating and ensure our staff have some income to survive on.  Along with these limited services  we have reduced our rates to match - approximately 75% off what we would charge during this time previously.

As part of these reduced services at present, our reception only opens from 9am to 5pm, after this our security team handles the communication from guests, who then contacts the on-call maintenance or management team.  Please do accept my apologies that this system didn't work during your emergency.  On investigating your review we could find no log or record of your call regarding your air-conditioner, nor did we find any non-operational air-conditioner in your villa after you checked out.

As part of our re-training effort during these quiet times I am personally inspecting all arrival villas with my executive Housekeeper and the housekeeping team that serviced the villa in order to ensure our standards of cleanliness are what they should be.  I personally inspected the villa that you checked in, a little less than an hour before you arrived, and find it difficult to  understand how the villa got so dusty, or the linen got so smelly, in this time.

Whilst we continue to provide breakfasts for guests that want to check out early, we do require some time in which to arrange this, unfortunately we could not accommodate your last minute request.

Our guests are our priority even with the reduction of some of our services or the time they are available.

text:
We stayed for 6 nights in a 2 bed villa. No 21.
The welcome was ok. Small reception, busy with a large family checking out, so it was harder for us getting in.
The villa was nice. Agree with some other reviews, the rooms are getting tired. 
Intercom didn’t work - asked for it to be repaired. Never was.
Large kitchen cabinet rolled, stayed fully open every time we closed it. shower platform not great, toilet in master stopped flushing 4 times, yes 4 times and repaired 3 times. Not blocked. Side button continued to play up. It was frustrating. Maintenance please repair again as the day we departed it again stopped flushing.

The beds were very stiff. I like firm but these were very firm and the thick timber edging around the bed drove me nuts as I walked in to the corners 3 times, dinting my shins. F$&k it hurt.

TV reception below average. WiFi coverage through whole villa average. I ended up 4G’ing and my wife and kids hot spotted thru me.

Service was great, very responsive. Thank you. Staff were very pleasant. Security staff, yeah they were ok, looked like they were couped up in a small 2x2 pen each time we rode in and out. Needed the bike as the long road/path in and out to Villa was exactly that. Long. Garden staff were beautiful. They have the gardens looking incredible.

Pool was awesome. Super deep. 2m+ and the pool inflatables were great. French fries was very cool. Sundeck chairs great and casual seating next to pool was heaven. 

Restaurant staff were all great. We preferred to dine in for breaky. Food was good. We ended up settling for poached eggs a lot of the time. Boring yes, but with 2 kids the food style was a little upper end. 

Be weary of mosquitos. Yes not the villas fault but they were heavy in particular around the kitchen and seating area. Yes room sprayed nightly but it wasn’t enough or the pump bottle  spray repellents need to be stronger. I ended up asking for 2 bottles to continue doing it myself. We’ve stayed at other villas in Bali and we found the slow Burning ones to be more effective. My daughter ended up with 39 bites. Yes I know. 

Anyway, a nice place to stay. Unlikely to return. We paid a handsome dollar to stay here and it needs improvement.

Thank you. Enjoyable, a good stay but not great.
title: Good but not great.

owner_response.text:
Dear Psiat,

Thank you for the review. Glad you had an enjoyable time with us - although we are disappointed, like you, that it wasn't perfect.
Super pleased you found the service, pool, gardens, restaurant staff, french fries, and pool area to be great.  Sorry about the beds and the driveway - not much we can do about those - although we do have a buggy service from the villa to reception and around the local area that you could have called, and taxis can come down the driveway right to the villa - something to consider for your next visit.
Apologies for the kitchen cabinet door that kept opening, and the issues with the toilet button - I know how these little things can really become frustrating.
Thanks for the reminder to our maintenance staff, we will ensure everything is repaired and in tip top shape.
Kind regards,
Andrew J Leith

text:
I love the design of villas - thanks to the hospitality of the villa management, accommodated my late check out request by moving me to a different villa. Only then did I realize each villa came with its own unique layout. However, I do think that the villas are a little jaded and could do wonders with some upgrading. One of the villa 15 bedroom doors was cracked and could do with a replacement. Experienced low water pressure from the rain showers. One of the toilet flush wasn’t working well but got rectified immediately when brought to the attention of the reception staff. I had also expected daily replenishment of the fruit platter but that didn’t happen. 
The extremely hot weather didn’t help and made staying in the shaded outdoor family area unbearable despite switching on the fans at full blast. We stayed cooped up in the air con rooms during most of daytime and only moved outdoors in the evening. 
Overall, a decent place to stay but I had expected a lot more from the luxurious The Layar.
title: Expected a lot more from The Layar Designer Villas and Spa.

owner_response.text:
Dear Jimmie,

Please do accept my apologies for the issues you faced during your stay with us.  I am pleased, however, that these were rectified immediately and that you were able to enjoy your complimentary late check out.  Yes it has been very hot in Bali over the last few weeks and we all hope for the rains to come soon.
Please be assured we are doing our utmost to keep the villas in as pristine condition as possible, and will look at replacing the door you mentioned.
I do hope you will think of us on your return to Bali
Kind regards,
Andrew J Leith

text:
We stayed in villa 12 (3 bedroom) for my birthday. The villa is stunning. It took a little to get use to the outdoor bathrooms and showers especially only cold water in the shower except for a burst of hot water that maybe lasts no longer than 5-10 seconds.

The staff use a WhatsApp number for any requests or queries. They were so professional, attentive and helpful. 

We did the in room BBQ one night and that was fabulous. Definitely recommend this for anyone staying. We had breakfast in our room which was lovely too but then we ate in the restaurant and preferred that. Purely for the fact you get to eat your food as soon as it’s made, hot and fresh.

The gardens are beautiful and the pool and inflatables were a hit with the kids.

A couple of us had the in room massage service which was also great.

The main room air conditioning didn’t work well at all so we ran a fan that we found in the lounge but still the nights were hot. The other two rooms were fine. This villa had sun to the pool most of the day which was so nice.

The buggy dropped us to Seminyak Sq for shopping which was nice. Shame they don’t do a collection service as well.

We had a wonderful time and would definitely recommend. Be sure to visit Tempted the sister restaurant of Settimo Cielo which is down the road. The owner/host was exceptional and the food and restaurant outstanding!
title: Stunning villa and amazing staff

text:
Stayed with family and friends for 7 night in a two bedrooms last month. The overall experience was great, however there are rooms for improvement. 

1. Location is excellent, it is only 10 mins walk to the eat street, and takes about 5 mins ride anywhere within seminyak. 

2. When we first stepped in the villa, we felt the villa was a bit tired. Given the living room is in an open concept, the furniture is a bit tired. The bathroom has water stains and water pressure wasn’t great either. There was one night one of our room did not have hot water. The kitchen wasn’t perfectly clean, there are stains on the sink. The upside is the sounding system, speaker is all ard the villa which is perfect! 

3. The swimming pool is in good size with sun exposure, but the water was cold especially when there was no sun. I am not comfortable to let my 3yo boy to swim too long in the water. We can only jump into the water by noon time when there was great sunlight. They provide two floaties which was great! 

4. Good selection on the breakfast, but quality wasn’t as good as other comments. The coffee was average. We ordered our own coffee outside (Revolver was great!). I spent one day to have breakfast in the restaurant, quality definitely better. There was one day we requested for early breakfast before 7, they have sent a breakfast box which was pretty bad, we didn’t eat it in the end. 

5. Overall service was great, they have this WhatsApp number which make everything so efficient! The driver who sent us back to the airport was very friendly too! 

With this price range, I thought the layar could have done better. But having said that my friends and I had a great time in Bali!
title: Excellent location and services, tired villa

owner_response.text:
Dear Potatomary,

I am so pleased that you had a great stay overall, and thank you for the points for improvement.  On a personal note I am disappointed that you didn't rate our coffee as we have our own specialty blend and like to think I am somewhat of a coffee aficionado.

To your other points - we will be looking at refreshing the furniture and soft furnishings shortly, and please do accept my apologies for the less than perfectly clean sink.  We will also look at the quality of the complimentary breakfast boxes.

Thank you again for the review they are appreciated.
Andrew J Leith
General Manager

text:

we had to call the front desk 4-5 times to get the wifi sorted. The staff who came were lovely, but this was very inconvenient as we couldn't get wifi in the bedrooms 3/5 days
towels are getting quite old, due to the number of washes. They certainly weren't dirty, but they weren't new either

Overall, great staff, great location and a nice space that needs some TLC

text:
My wife and I were in Seminyak for a wedding. We booked a 4 bed villa with 3 other couples and couldn’t have been happier with it. The villa itself was huge. 4 large bedrooms, each with a beautiful outdoor en suite. Is it even Bali if you don’t have an outdoor shower? There was a great kitchen, massive indoor dining and living areas, great garden and beautiful pool surrounded by daybeds. Oh and a private massage room. Could not fault the villa at all.  

Each morning a great breakfast was included. You could have this up at the restaurant or have the lovely staff bring it to your villa. The service overall was amazing. Full villa clean and turndown service each day, food delivered any time of day, massages in the villa, free shuttle service around Seminyak, help to rent scooters or anything else you needed. Always with a smile. 

The villa itself may not be cheap by Bali standards, but you certainly get what you pay for. And at the end of our week the room service, massages and everything else additional ink came to a couple hundred bucks per family. 

Definitely recommend this place and would return.
title: Perfect villa in Seminyak

text:
We booked to stay at the 3 bedrooms for 5 nights and decided to extend another a week & half. We were forced to move literally for 3 times, which we didnt get. It was so inconvenient & and their reason were nonsense. Also they messed up my breakfast order, so how you order your breakfast is usually they will call you the day before and get your breakfast order. So the next morning, the got my order wrong, and of course i asked for the eggs that i wanted. They wouldnt serve it to me & wanted to charge me IDR300K for literally just eggs, & the order they messed up. The manager was rude about it even. So we checkout days earlier & left for W Bali instead. W Bali is the best and i've stayed there ever since. Now, The Layar is really pretty in the day, but in the night is so dark. Theres not enough lights . 

Just a tip from a girl who's in Bali at least 4 times a year :

With the money you spend at The Layar, I strongly suggest you spend it at W Bali, Alila Uluwatu, Bale or elsewhere thats nicer.

text:
We visited the Layar as part 1 of our honeymoon to Bali. We were immediately struck by how tastefully done the villa was decorated. The staff could not do more to welcome us.

We are from the restaurant in our villa once for lunch and the beef rendang was amazing.

Each evening the sprayed the room to deter the mosquitos and the room was cleaned daily, including the pool and garden swept. Certainly the place to start an amazing trip and quite the honeymoon to remember.

The only downfall of this stay was our departure; we were checking out at 12 as planned and at 11:40/5 the villa appeared to descend on us. We were attempting to take a breath before leaving and outside in the kitchen two staff were clearing our breakfast dishes and washing up. Then another came in to check the minibar and at that point we were agitated.

The disappointing bit is one moment could dampen an entire stay.

text: The Layar is a fantastic alternative to hotels in Bali. We stayed in a one bedroom villa. The design is absolutely fabulous with everything one can desire in a holiday villa. The private pool is large and well kept. The service is outstanding and the staff friendly and helpful. The only negative I have is that unfortunately with the fabulous outdoor living room comes a very good sound system, and the Australian family next door used it PERMANENTLY at full volume. From 07:00 am to late at night. Everybody was forced to listen to their rather strange taste in music. I think this sound system should have a set maximum volume not to disturb other guests paying the same amount of money for peace and quiet. This can’t be left to occupants to decide, as clearly in our case, they can’t. Other than that, this is an excellent choice for accommodation in Bali.
title: Lovely but....

I am sorry to hear about the loud music from your family next door, usually when our guests comment about the music, our security and butlers immediately inform the guests in the villa and a have a procedure to follow.  Although it is a good suggestion to see if the sound system can be set at a maximum volume.  We regret to hear this affected your peace and quiet.  Thank you again for your feedback.

text: Spent 5 days at the Layar with a group of 20 family members and friends over Christmas / New Year. Although Bali was super crowded we were cocooned from the hustle and bustle in our lovely villas in Seminyak. We occupied 3 villas which were located next to each other so it was convenient to move between villas. The location of the Layar made it convenient for us to walk around Seminyak so we could avoid the traffic....Our butler Bayu was Super amazing. He arranged for tours for our large group although we did not give him much notice. We had a wonderful time white water rafting in Ubut. He also got us tables for meals at popular restaurants. He was always on hand with tips on where we should go and what we should try. Thank you Bayu .... Thank you also to the General Manager for arranging a lovely barbecue dinner for us in our villa on our last night in Bali...The food and service was exceptional. Thank you to The Layar for a really memorable holiday.

text:
We stayed at The Layar for 10 days over Christmas 2018 in one of their 3 bedroom villas. The villas are well maintained, very private,and pleasantly supported. Whilst we were there as a family of 5, this 3 bedroom villa could easily and comfortably accommodate 3 couples. They offer both dine-in food options with food delivered from the restaurant kitchen to your room, or you can dine at the delightful Settimo Cielo Italian restaurant.

Villas all have their own private pool, entertainment systems, kitchen/bar areas and beautiful courtyard gardens. The gardens around the villa grounds are also beautifully maintained.

Villa manager, Melida, is wonderful, and her hard-working staff are to be complimented for their outstanding service-oriented attitude, and happy demeanours. Melida also sent us a lovely bottle of wine to welcome us, and arranged a late check out to accommodate the late departure of our flight.

I would highly recommend a stay at The Layar
title: Relax to the max in the heart of Seminyak

Maid service was very good and they were very aware of when was the right time to perform their duties. Staff always went out of their way to please. 
There is a lovely restaurant on site the make delicious food especially breakfast as well as being easy walking distance to eat street and shops. If you wanted to venture further a field the office were always willing to assist.
I would certainly recommend these beautiful private villas to even the most discerning potential customers.

text:
We travelled with my elderly mother (84 years old) to Bali and stayed at The Layar for 8 nights. Unfortunatley, my mother hurt her back and was hospitalised in Bali. This was a very stressful time dealing with hospital/insurance/airlines etc. to ensure we could ultimately return home to Adelaide on our pre-booked flight and continue with her care needs once admitted to another hospital at home in Adelaide. Melida particularly (GM of The Layar), and her team of staff assisted us in numerous ways; contacting and interpreting details from the hospital, obtaining relevant documentation, organising late checkout, back up accommodation as a potential 'plan B', special transfer to airport/check-in etc. Thanks again Melida. You were truly outstanding with our ongoing stress filled situation!
Aside from the above, the Layar Villas are beautiful with great aesthetic appeal and closely situated to "eat street". We had breakfast every day in the attached restaurant and weren't disappointed with choices/quality. Coffee was consistently superb. Pool area and tropical gardens were stunning, and all staff very friendly.
We would highly recommend anyone to consider a stay at The Layar.
title: Great Assistance by General Manager

It was great to see you in the restaurant in the morning and we hope to welcome you back for a more relaxing stay in the future! Thank you for your high recommendation!

text:
We enjoyed our stay at The Layar, our 3 bedrooms villa is beautifully designed and very clean. The staffs are friendly, kept the villa clean at all times, helped us with reservation requests. The food is also excellent, so is the in-villa spa treatment. The Layar is located in the heart of Semiyak with walking distance to many great restaurants. 

Only issue we had and would like to give feedback to the villa management is the bed frames design. The bed frames are designed with the end of the frame stands out in a triangle shape, with its dark frame sitting on a similarly dark color carpet, it's very easy to miss the end of the frame and walk into it, to get hurt on the legs. During our stay it happened several times, one of our guests even fell on the floor after hitting the bed frame one night. This poses potential safety risk hence recommend to change the bed frame design or to change the carpet to a lighter color.
title: Beautifully designed villa at a good location, but beds design need to be changed

text:
We travelled with another family and stayed at Villa 1 (2 Bedroom). Although closest to reception which is ideal, I was expecting more grass space for my 5 year old son to be able to run around in. There was also barely any direct sunlight, the space felt quite small. We also had two toddlers (1.5 year olds) with us who are active walkers and explorers and found the villa to be quite dangerous for them; we had a pool fence installed but the furniture style boasts sharp and hard edges and villa has LOTS of steps which is not obvious through their photos. 

So without the grass area, the children were left to play in the minimal tiled area of the lounge area with the steps! I was close to requesting a move however considering we had the pool fence installed, I decided to forego it. 

Service wise, they are excellent in that it’s a full service villa so they can pretty much help with anything you need and will go out of their way to help. 

The shortfalls are in the details when comparing to previous luxury villas we’ve stayed at; a couple of times our bathroom door was left open after housekeeping which meant mosquitos entering our bedroom, in villa food service was excellent but clean up service hardly came quickly which meant our leftovers would be sitting out catching bugs and lastly,  there was no microwave available.

Overall it was a beautiful villa, great service but not perfect for us. Perhaps if we were to stay there next time, we’d request a villa with larger grass space and we’d enjoy a different experience. 

Location - just okay but the free local shuttle made it great!!
title: Beautiful Villa but a few shortfalls

Should you decide to return to The Layar, please let me know and I am happy to allocate you a villa with a larger grass space.
